string.text: There's a case... We need to find--
Yeah, there's something... We need to find--
Did you find it yet? I need to--
Did you get it? This thing right here--

It seems that the last, seventh part of the documents in Pripyat is missing... However, I got a message from Freedom that one of their groups went missing in the Chernobyl area, and they had a red folder with them... maybe that's what you need. We should try to find them in the vicinity of the power plant. According to Freedom, they were traveling in an APC.

Yeah, I heard that Rat gave you the keys to the old place... You're telling me to put another safe in there? Well... you can, of course. Only, I think you understand some of the nuances... Well, first of all, the safe itself. I remember there was one in some hut here in Bar... let's say I put it together. Then the lock must be put in order with the door, so that no one stole anything, because here people are clever on this case... And most importantly, so that no one steals the safe, it should be magnetized to something. Like against the wall of the house... ask me how? You know about the Magnet artifact, right? So, few people know, it has a property - if you stick it to the surface, it magnetizes any matter. Anyway,.. I'm in, but I'll take 5,000 for the job and four Magnet artifacts. Do you agree?

Professor:\nThe group we were expecting is now in the Cordon area, preparing to evacuate the zone. Your job is to go there, and lead the group along the road through the highway to the exit of the zone. I'm sending their coordinates, you'll get all the instructions on the spot. Hurry up. Over and out.
A pill to induce drowsiness quickly.

Informant: Messer, one of the stalker squads has decided to move far into the Zone and explore the territory of the Silent Hills. Among the squad's stalkers, more than half are elite. Equipped they were superbly... can you go see what's wrong with them? Anything you find on them is yours. Just tell me what happened to them. Alright? There were three stalkers in the group - two in exoskeletons, one was in a black science jumpsuit, unless of course he'd changed costumes... I know for a fact he's a sniper. They went missing in the area of the village... When you find them, contact me. Waiting for the signal...

Messer. Here's the thing, the Jackal's been in touch. Sending out an SOS signal. The message was misshapen in the transmission, he had something about the dark ones. Bullshit... I spotted him underground in the Cordon area, obviously from the underground tunnels. Why don't you go check it out? You'll get to see each other face to face.

Markov gave some kind of artifact... in the Bar area, a zombified stalker has reappeared in one of the apartment buildings. Offers to kill two birds with one stone - get rid of a troublesome stalker, and conduct an experiment... We need to plant this artifact next to him, which should... disintegrate the stalker...
Markov did something with that artifact from the first order... Now we need to expose it to high temperatures...

Major Kravtsov: My brother was forcibly drawn to the killers... He was forced to shoot another stalker... or they would have killed him themselves. There was nothing left for him to do... We need to find him, get him out of the assassins' base, then bring him back to our base. Preferably at night, so no one can see you...

Working for the Killers... that's new. Looks like the clan leader wants to cooperate? Then why are the others hostile? Too many questions... Nevertheless, you need to kill the stalker at the MedPribor Research Institute. He's hiding in the underground... The leader gave a tip that the basements of the Research Institute can be accessed through the underground of the Garbage, so as not to receive radiation on the territory of the Research Institute...

We got a tip from Lone Wolf. He made it clear that they wouldn't just let me into the bar... We need to get some documents from the Dark Valley. This will be my fee for passing into the circle of experienced stalkers... There's some crazy psi noise in the Dark Valley, we need protection. So Wolf gave me a tip on a special helmet you can get from the military, near the creek in the Garbage.
Toad's account of the lower levels of the Garbage.

According to Toad, he once saw a group of scientists in the Garbage a long time ago. They walked around, measured something, and went off toward the hangar, apparently into the underground rooms. Then, once under the blowout hit them, and may still be lying there by the railway tunnel in a hollow on the Garbage. Maybe I can find something from them that can open up access to the lower levels. You need an access code... Said if I got in and found anything interesting, to bring it to him, he will pay.

Looks like we managed to find Strelok's stash, but it looks like there's nothing of value here... Found some book, on a side note which stated that the PDA was stashed behind the main scientific complex of the MedPribor Research Institute in the basement... We should try to find them...

Yeah, one more thing... there's a case. In that place, in the hangars, there's a passageway... There, deep underground, on the lower level of the tunnels, the stalkers discovered a large metal gate... Scans have confirmed that there are large underground rooms behind the gates... Come on, go downstairs and see what's going on. Report back to me later. I'm dumping the entry point there into your PDA.
News and events in the Zone
A request from the leader of Clear Sky

Winds of Madness...what it means... Anyway, apparently the road to the center of the Zone goes through Lake Yantar, namely a certain scientist Professor. He's the one who's going to have to help me with this... but I don't know if he'll want to help me. Maybe to get what I need, I'll have to work for the academia first...

Discovered a strange mutant... It looks like a meter maid, only... more disfigured... Maybe we can find something interesting to do with this mutant. Something tells me this isn't just a simple mindless goon...there's something else...

We need to investigate the underground utilities beneath the Cordon. Before me, a group of stalkers had already disappeared there... You need to find some interesting thing for Toad from there and bring it to the Cordon.

Docent handed out a test sample of a device that would be used to stay under the blowout without shelter... But, in order for him to finish his work, this sample must be laid out in the open in the active phase of emission, when it is already hitting the brains... dangerous business.
This is the road to the Big City... it's closed now, the radiation's too strong. That's where that radio program was from... You don't want to go that way right now.
The journalist is missing. Followed me north... we need to find him, but first, on the Doctor's tip-off, we need to visit his apartment in Shining Path. Maybe I can find something.

Everything seems ready for the trek north... The Duty Group should be waiting on Radar by now. We have a 9 p.m. to 11 p.m. window available... in which time I need to break into the lab and shut down the Woodpecker. After that, in theory, the road to Pripyat will be open...

Next assignment from Toad... You need to find some kind of artifact on the tower that is on the railroad bridge and bring it to him. Gotta remember the detector... damn, the battery is completely near zero...

Got the gun from Toad... it's a mess, but at least it's something. We have to go down the road, under the underpass. There's a stalker waiting for me there, I think I'll need to take someone down with him... Or something...

Looks like another errand. On the roof of the factory, the Flesh that we've slaughtered has made a lair, where Toad says there are documents. We should find them and bring them to him. Without them, he won't talk to me.

Now that's serious business... We need to rescue the commander of the military patrol and get him out of there. It's located at the factory where the SOS signal is coming from. We need to check gear and first aid kits. And a grenade from Toad would be nice...
After another emission, the Toad's Eye artifact appeared in the Garbage. We need to find it and bring it to Toad. He gave me the coordinates. I wonder why no one wants to go after it.

There's a message from Toad saying a certain Boar knows something about Strelok... It is located in the north of the Garbage, at a roadblock of the Duty faction. We need to talk to him, and then go back to Toad and his eye artifact...

Damn, this sucks. Woke up in a strange place... that Toad is a very murky man. He wants me to work it off, fine. I need to pick up a crate from the bench in the merchant's bunker, and take it to the roadblock. And from there in turn pick up the other box and bring it to Toad...

First serious, real outing. We need to be well prepared... It's probably not a good idea to go alone, either. I need to try and find someone on Cordon who agrees to go to the Research Institute with me. It's worth talking to the locals, see if anyone will agree. Well, if not, I guess you can take your own chances...
Talk to the leader of Duty
On my way out of Shining Path, I received a message from the leader of the Duty faction. We need to talk to him.
There was a message from the Informant in Bar, it is necessary to find in the basements of the MedPribor Research Institute some gravity hammer created by the Burers and bring it to him.

Well, I guess the truth is out there. Now I can power down the mythical Black Monolith. You need to go down to the lower levels of the lab under Radar, and get to the control room of the installation. The lower door access code is 5489.

We need to control the flight of the convoy for the Yantar scientists. The professor issued a rifle, which must then be returned... Also, you can't show up in the village and shine there, you have to do everything quietly if possible.

The professor gave the assignment to catch the mutant that everyone calls Flesh... how to do it? The hell he knows... It's probably gonna take a lot of running, because it's a cowardly creature. According to the coordinates, it's in one of the houses in Bright Beam.

The professor said, a car with a load from the Big Land was driving to the mobile base. The connection was cut right at the entrance to the Exclusion Zone on Cordon... We need to find the scientist and deliver the cargo to the Professor. He didn't say anything about the cargo itself, but since his colleague was traveling by car, perhaps delivering the cargo on foot would be problematic...

The science bunker on Yantar is experiencing food supply problems. It is necessary to bring them food for further cooperation. I think ten canned goods will be enough for them. It's worth talking to Toad, maybe he can sell such a large batch in bulk at once...

The professor needs a measurement of the air with the spores of the parasite. In order to make such a measurement, it is necessary to lay out the device given by him near any corpse infected with this contagion...

The backpack from a stalker's kit. You can use it as a stash for loot, but you can't fit much in it. Also, you need to consider the fact that it can be stolen, so you should hide it in a secluded place.

When I was born, the Zone already existed... It's true, the old people said that there was a time when the territory of the settlement was outside the Zone... But I don't remember that... There are legends that somewhere there is some Outer World or huge City... that's where the helicopters come from sometimes and the new stalkers come from... But something happened there a few years ago... Maybe the visiting stalkers know something more specific about this Outer World.

Strelok... he also came from the outside, they say he was an important figure in the outside world, but nobody really knows anything. There were even rumors that fanatics from the Sin Clan believed that something important depended on him... maybe he was thrice-born, too?

Goplit knew something about him, we're from the same village... he always wanted to be a writer, he said he loved the fantasy genre. There heroes always acted there, and even if they were lonely, still defeated evil in the end... Goplit said something about the Journalist, the latter was looking for something, and Goplit bragged that he had found it... but whether he gave it to the Journalist or not, I don't know.

Alright, don't rattle on, we'll get to your base, see what you accidentally grabbed. In the meantime, I should get something to eat, because I've forgotten when I've had anything in my mouth other than knocked out teeth. You didn't grab anything but folders in that archive?

Hmmm... I'm a business man. You work for us. you're looking for Strelok, aren't you? I have information about him. But do the job first and then we'll call it even, stalker. You're right about the radiation. But, that fugitive who needs to say hello from us is hiding somewhere in the basements of the research institute... and there's no radiation... I mean, in case you didn't know, the Garbage dungeons are connected to the NII underground, so if you go that way, you won't need the suit in theory. I'll give you the passage info from the underground to the NII...
Some scientist on the roof of Bar asked to find him if possible this artifact, attaching only a photo without any description...

It's an unremarkable folder. You can tell from the cover that it has been used more than once, but all the sheets inside are laminated and uncharacteristically thick. The content is impressive - it's nothing short of a psi helmet assembly manual. Even at a cursory glance, it can be seen that each sheet is designed with the utmost care so that it can be understood by a knowledgeable professional. From the sketches and attached photos, it can be understood that the device is not particularly difficult to assemble, but, judging from the numerous notes and attached experimental results, requires a certain knowledge of neurobiology and cybernetics for fine-tuning, as well as rare or difficult-to-make parts for efficient operation.

PDA found a message for someone named Major: R-138, there's a new order. From our friends at bloodcall... into an anthill. It's a big order. There's a rumor that a Frankenstein stalker has been seen in the Zone. The Doctor put it together from other stalkers' body parts. Literally. We can't get to the Doctor in the Swamps - too high psi activity prevents us from reaching his hole, but the stalker himself is still wandering around the Zone somewhere. Find him and bring him to the Perimeter. Alive, if possible. I already gave my eagles the Frankenstein's description. But you have a better chance of finding him. Send the number of the account - I'll pay in advance, if you agree.
... The major's got everyone on it to find him... killers...dark... The Doctor..., his masterful work... put together a few pieces... We can't let him get to the Major... you can't...

I can help with that... Only the result won't be immediate... you know, you have to make inquiries, who's been where when, and so on... Yeah, one more thing. There are two options you can choose from.\nSo the first... two thousand, and in a little while I'll send you the approximate location of the document you're interested in on the PDA.\nEither the second... I'm the one who's pulling my strings and getting you the document you need. All you have to do is come and get it from me. It will cost more... ten grand total. So, what do you need to find?

Test results of the Posthuman Project.\nIn the document folder, you can find a sheet with the title conclusion. Based on the results, the following conclusions can be drawn: 1) the project is still too far from completion, 2) we should focus on finding a method that combines both the intelligence enhancement of the test material and the effective maximization of external cortex radiation, 3) we should involve the neuroengineering department in the project to consult on the issue of psi overload.
Exchange for a code to the lab

The leader of one of the bandit groups in the Dark Valley has agreed to give the password to enter the lab. For this information he asks for a VSK-94 rifle, and five bottles of vodka. Or five jars of jelly... He asked me to say hello to the Informant in Bar...

A large pile of papers with various records...\nIn order to make research work safer and more stable (after several unfortunate incidents), it was decided to administer a third kind of psi-influence to all laboratory workers, from cleaners to scientists. Everyone will be fitted with adaptable psi-blocks that will prevent anyone from disrupting operations, rioting, stealing data, and pogroms or escapes.\nMessage ...there was a conflict between a group of scientists developing psychotropic weapons and the leaders of Project Cover-up. Scientists did not want to be exposed to the rays of the weapons they themselves were developing. Realizing that psi-impact is a matter of time the scientists began to ponder the situation and came up with a plan to free them from danger.
Cooked meat. Completely ready for safe consumption.

The development of psychotronic weapons initiated in the USSR led to the creation of the OSOZNANIE project in 2006, the laboratories of which are located on the territory of ZOCHAES. The idea of the projet is to influence the information shell of the earth, the "noosphere", through which it is possible to influence any individual on the planet. A group of scientists, guided by presumably humane considerations, not excluding, however, the mercenary in essence idea of the gray cardinals of the planet, turn on the generators and begin an experiment that allows, in their opinion, to stop violence, war, crime and so on. This idealistic in essence experiment leads to the breakage of something in the very essence of the universe, as a result of which begins to change nature and its inhabitants so far in the local volume of the Zone. Realizing the fact that something unplanned is happening, but at the same time realizing that it is up to them to eliminate the consequences, the participants of the experiment block the passage to the Center of the zone with psi-fields, and create a mythical Wish Granter, located under the sarcophagus of the Chernobyl NPP, which is actually a "Monolith" psi-installation, causing halluciogenic visions, in the form of the apparent realization of the individual's desires. Also, the group has a psi influence on the leaders of the states to prevent massive attacks using the army on the center of the zone, which could lead to the destruction of the generators, which still give a chance to return everything to normal. Plus they force representatives of the authorities to prevent people from entering the Zone in every possible way (military stalkers, cordons, etc.). Their people who have reached the center of the Zone and fallen under the influence of "Monolith", form either squads of zombie defenders, or wipe their memories and take them far away from the center of the Zone, or send the hardiest to eliminate undesirable people, both in the Zone and outside it. This procedure of total zombification is codenamed S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Strelok is one of the latter. He realistically learned too much to be left alive, but just as any complex system can fail, so in his case, instead of being eliminated, he was zombified and sent to kill himself. And only the fact that he seems to have an innate ability to easily tolerate this kind of exposure has led to the fact that he is still acting sensibly...
Transmitter Main Module Control Access Card.
Experimental prototype T-ZUD-12 (ultra pressure protection). Faulty. Probably has value.
A device for shielding against the effects of emission on the body. Protects against emission damage, has a limited lifespan.

A sample of special equipment to survive a blowout. Scientists have discovered that during emission in the Zone there is a strange activity, it is necessary to find out the nature of these phenomena. To measure, the instrument must be laid out in an open area during the intermediate emission phase.

When the commotion started, I accidentally got into some room, they don't lock a damn thing in there, they must have been sure no one would get in... So there's some sort of archive, I took as many folders as I could fit in my duffel bag. I don't know why, but they're prized in the Zone. The Watchdog wouldn't let us trade information... Maybe he was dealing it himself. And what good are these papers, but you can sell them, and good money, and enough for food, and...

RGO (GRAU index - 7G22) - hand-held anti-personnel defensive percussion-distance grenade. The grenade is designed to engage manpower in defensive combat. The grenade is delivered to the target only by throwing it by the soldier's hand. The grenade fragmentation damage radius is 50 meters, and the potential damage radius is 100 meters. The grenade is similar to the F-1 grenade, but differs from it by the use of a combined percussion and remote fuse. A grenade explodes when it hits a hard surface. The grenade's fuse is all-durable, detonating regardless of the surface inclination or position of the grenade. The fuse is cocked 1.3-1.8 seconds after the safety lever is released (throwing the grenade), which eliminates the possibility of instantaneous explosion in case of accidental encounter with an obstacle at a short distance from the grenade launcher. If the grenade is not detonated by a percussion fuze, the grenade will self-destruct by detonation 3.2-4.2 seconds after the safety lever is released. In this the action of the grenade is completely similar to that of F-1, RG-42, RGD-5 grenades. The battle grenade is colored an olive grayish color. The training simulation grenade is colored black.

The mediator was generally unsociable, so I don't know about his affairs. He rarely came here, and if he did, he wasn't here for long. He was often seen on Yantar because he was testing something for the scientists there at one time. Came in here today, about an hour before his body was found. Asked about all sorts of things. Asked questions about you, too, by the way.

The last person who talked to him was Sanya Borov. Things weren't the warmest between them, you know. I once heard that Mediator ditched Sanya for the loot when they went to the Garbage. They just had another scandal today, and I had to kick them out. So far, all suspicions fall on Sanya, especially since he wanted to get away when he was found at the murder scene.

Maybe someone's trying to cover their tracks by using your name... I think Khmyr was hanging around the table where Sanya was standing... Where he is now, I don't know. He left when the trouble started. That's suspicious... I would talk to the Informant about this topic. Hubby was just talking to him.

I've been there... Up north. Went through the Incinerator. Three days from the monolithians... Hiding in basements. Then back he went... Again via Burnout... I've been sandpapered twice already... It wasn't without consequences... I'm told there's a clinic. On the Big Land. Where they treat this kind of thing, where they get their brains right... Here I am.

Not all items found in the area are safe. Weapons, food, artifacts, objects, everything can be exposed to radioactive contamination.
A thing like this, even in a backpack, can be very background. So be sure to carry a dosimeter or detector.
With its presence you can check if the object is infected. Just look it over in the backpack. If yes, it will beep.
Now a little bit about radiation sickness.
It is possible to get radiation sickness by staying in areas of high contamination or by eating contaminated food. It is expressed as a permanent decline in health and stamina. On top of that, you get a yellowish haze in front of your eyes... The higher the contamination, the higher these negative effects.
It can only be fought by taking large quantities of anti-rads, vodka, and some scientists seem to cure this ailment.
You can keep an eye on the infection rate by getting checked out by scientists. They may have already made some sort of diagnostic device.
Stalker Toad, 05/21/2007.

Messer, aren't you in the village area right now? There's a hobo from the Garbage was bringing me a package from the bar, but he disappeared somewhere in the neighborhood. Go and see what's in there, and if you find anything, bring it to me right away. We're out.
What are you doing out there?

Took the Mediator his container... He... Didn't want to give it back nicely. I had to... Do the wrong thing. I've dealt with it, but the container won't open... A lock with a code, man... We should... Back to our meeting place... We should have gotten the code to that thing before we took him down. If I can open it. I'll be cured.

Pocket personal computer. The owner of the PDA didn't bother deleting recent posts. One of the latest PDA messages from the owner of the Stalker place: ''He's moving North. Last seen at the Garbage. You follow him until he's not will make it to the center. Don't go to Pripyat, it's a dead end. subject. If he goes through town, come back - the military will finish him off themselves.

Subject has located passage 1 and 3, protruding into sector 28.
Teams White, Green to Sector 26 for evacuation.
Groups Red: in the area of the Dark Valley, in the laboratory sector the exit to the Cordon dungeons.
Groups Blue: three samples of anomalous formations #24 were found on Cordon. In the area of the factory entrance, water tower, destroyed building in the village.
To all groups: The backup weapons stash is located on the Radar property, tag attached to the message. Use only when absolutely necessary.
Contact the major about the facility.

Electricity supply data.
Data on the presence of a powerful source of electric power consumption directly behind the Chernobyl NPP.
The data has been corrupted.
Backup code of the lower level of the energy center under Radar territory- Data corrupted

I had a strange dream. The hulk of the Chernobyl plant in the semi-darkness. Everything looks peaceful. A lone man appears. I can see him from the back against the power plant. The wind is starting to blow. Suddenly a sea of rats starts scattering away from the power plant in different directions. A man standing with his back to me, shooting rats. Suddenly there's a shout: "Strelok!". The man flinches, freezes for a moment and slowly starts to turn towards me, but...the moment before I would have seen his face, I woke up...what does this dream mean? I don't know...But I think it's something I've seen before.
An air analyzer set up to analyze parasite spores. To activate, you must lay the device out near the source of the spore.
Watch out! You're near the anomalies. Use bolts to define their boundaries.
Universal energy module for PSI weapons.
Personalized Access Card. Used by scientific groups.
Gravigranata RGD5. Increased damage radius, strongly throws off the bodies of enemies.
Gravigranata F1. Increased kill radius, attracts enemies during the explosion, bounces enemies' bodies back hard.
Strongly bounces the bodies of enemies, changing the trajectory of the flight.
Personalized Access Card. Used by scientific groups.
I remember everything! Give the Winds of Madness cyclicity chart to Messer. He has to go!
Documents about "Winds of Madness" with the Professor's notes (Winds of Madness Cycle Chart)

This file appears to have been attempted to be burned. Cover shows signs of sooting, page corners blackened. Those sheets with records of experiments conducted in the Zone were supplemented with the Professor's notes. On the back of some chart, a message to Messer is written in the Professor's handwriting. 
 "Messer, forgive me. I've devoted my whole life to science. I believed in progress and its good for humanity. I set great goals for myself, but now I see where my actions have led. I didn't want this. I am sorry you have to live in this world, but there is nothing I can do to make up for my mistakes. Go to the North - there you will find the answers to all your questions. Thanks to these papers, I was able to calculate the exact cooling time of the installation that keeps stalkers out of the Center. You can turn it off by sneaking in to the maintenance lab when it's not running at full capacity. The cooling phase begins at 9pm and lasts about two hours. But even at this time, the installation is still active, so you can't get close without psi protection. 
 I hope I was able to help you in some way. Please don't blame me for what I did. But now I can't rest easy seeing the "marvelous new" world I had a hand in. Go North, Messer. You need to go." 
 Professor
It's alright, come on in. We're just waiting for you...
[Huge amount of information not readily available. It is a mishmash of code that, until then, perhaps someone will be able to decipher...]
Shut down life support system three.
Shut down life support system four.
Life support system one is offline
Life support system two is offline
Life support system three is down
Life support system four is offline
Disconnect the power supply to the plant
The power to the unit is turned off
Emergency containment of the complex has been deactivated
attach the silencer to the gun
attach the silencer to the rifle

This file appears to have been attempted to be burned. Cover shows signs of sooting, page corners blackened. The folder contains ten sheets of notes on experiments being conducted in the Zone. If Sin's leader locked it in the safe, there was a reason. Also in the folder is a draft of a letter whose recipient is V.M. Chubko. 
 "Just got back from testing the Kaymanov rig. Not only were the drugs not distributed to everyone, but the biological material is walking around the building unguarded. There's a clear lack of safety in plain sight. Installing it is no good at all. Total cost of equipment and cooling system. I'm already studying their blueprints (don't ask me how I got them, you won't believe me anyway). I'll send them to you with the letter so you can see for yourself. This installation requires a nuclear power plant nearby, so you can forget about any mobility. And if its lockup overheats, the whole rig will get out of control and start messing with everyone's brains indiscriminately. Want to normally secure the Center Lab from foreign elements, use ours. 
 However, the choice is yours. If you want to have a problematic transmitter at your side, have it, Vladimir Mikhailovich. But I'm not responsible for the consequences. Next time I will send a formal complaint to the Panel for consideration." 
 Prikhodko P.S.
Turn on the emergency lighting of the complex
The emergency lighting of the complex is on
Open the front door to the complex
A tablet with a hand drawn map of the area.

Anomalies are small areas of the Zone in which the physical laws familiar to humans have been seriously altered. Anomalies produce artifacts - various kinds of items with unique properties that stalkers hunt for. Anomalies, along with mutants, are a key feature that distinguishes the Zone from the rest of the surface of planet Earth. Features:
- spawn artifacts when monsters die in them
- can be deactivated when spawning an artifact
- can be deactivated by some equipment
- deactivated anomalies are reactivated after emission of anomalies.

Features:
- to get full known properties you need a description of the sample in PDA
- may have different price and weight depending on the sample
- may change properties after a blowout
- lose their properties when used
- fully discharged artifact loses its properties

Features:
- some individuals are afraid of fire and psi sources
- some individuals such as rats and crows are edible (they can also be specially cooked on a campfire)
- some individuals have certain tissue samples that may be of interest to traders and scientists (need mutant information in PDA)

Don't you worry... and don't you dare threaten me here. The Dutyers have an interest in my work, and I'm not afraid of anything. They'll protect me if they have to. So you said you came by to say hello? Hmm. Stalker, huh? I can see from your face that you're clearly an experienced man, you must have seen a lot... When you're out in the zone, bring me one of these if you get a chance. This is so to speak my main object of study here in general. Sent you a photo. I won't hurt you with money, don't worry. This thing is rare, it doesn't come along very often, and I need it. Take care.

Would you believe me if I told you what organization I'm from? Ha, I'm not sure. The fact that you got the artifact really speaks volumes... at least for me. I think you and I have a business relationship to continue. Here, as well as the general five hundred as a reward... You ask what the artifact is. You know...it's not easy. Although it does occur in the zone, too. Its true properties I do not yet know, however, it is not a simple bling, no. There's something hidden in it...something beyond our understanding. Yeah, it certainly sounds commonplace here in the zone, but it's a truly unique specimen in terms of its potential... Tell you what, come see me in a day. I will do some experiments with this sample. Afterward, if you come back, I'll pay you twice as much for your next assignment.

And the fact that even with partial activation, it was possible to... That's what you're going to find out - you need a practical experiment. Here, take a sample. You need to do a full activation of this sample already. How do you do that? It's very simple. It needs to be exposed to ultra-high temperatures. I don't know the neighborhood much, so I have no idea where to get a heat source higher than a hundred or two degrees around here. You've seen a lot of things, haven't you? In general, throw the sample in some place with elevated ambient temperature and see what happens. Then report back to me what you see. As promised, I'll pay twice as much as last time. Alright, go, I'll wait for the results.

...The PDA battery is almost dead... I think this is the last note. It is not known exactly how long I have been here, but I think it is possible to get out... because you can hear the sounds! It's like being behind a wall. There's a lot of people walking around... I've been yelling, but no one seems to have heard me yet. I think I'm gonna make it out. I heard the one from the death truck slipping me something. he's the reason I'm here. It's okay, when I get out of here, I'll tell everyone what he is. And the General,... they thought I don't know. The main thing is to get out before the food supply runs out... It's okay, I'll tell everyone. Strelok said, s...
Start it up - Z. Controls: WASD. Shifting gears - LCtrl,LShift.
Handbrake - Space. Headlights - L. Door - T. Trunk - F.

Psychotropic influence and zombification on a global scale
1. Invisible and imperceptible influence. General behavioral emphases on behavior in large masses of people (cities).
2. Impact on underground political groups
3. Creating a favorable environment for the official introduction of planetary-scale psi effects. Statewide correction of people's psyche, mood and mental state.
4. Correcting the attention of masses of people in order to hide, disguise information about psychotropic research. Causing an artificial loss of interest in parapsychology.
5. There are psi keys on major major major cities that will turn up to 50% of the population into biorobots
6. The first steps (successful tests of large-scale influence at the state level) - mass transition to the old currency (Soviet rubles).

Controllers are ex-humans with introduced surgical and biochemical brain changes. They have the ability to control other living organisms using microlepton brainwaves (simply put, telepathy). Dressed in semi-sporty tight-fitting uniforms, predominantly black in color.
1. Completely mute
2. capture and zombify stalkers with parts of documents
3. Stop any attempts by researchers to penetrate to the center of the Zone
4. Control the mutants of the Zone
5. Set up psi generators to zombify animals and humans.
6. Prefer to operate at night. However, quite capable during the day.
All major takedowns are conducted at night. Factions Roadblock 7. They don't touch military stalkers

...Beneath the ground lie the bodies of the unified consciousness their condition is near coma. In the lab is one of the bodies controlled from underground. It carries out their will, controls external processes, and provides their bodies with everything they need. It is representative of the O-Consciousness Project... children were "harvested" by the o-consciousness to prepare a more powerful replacement...

You're leaving after all, eh. Even though the old man refused to give you his notes on the cyclical nature of the Winds of Madness. No offense to him, he's been here in the Zone for a hell of a long time. She's like a... What can you compare the Zone to without leaving the Zone? Only with the Zone itself.

I don't take offense. I've got some paperwork right here. I picked them up at the Sin Clan lair. Maybe you could use them for something. Everything I need to know I already know, and what's missing to complete the picture is not in them anyway, Give it to the professor. I gotta go.

We all, in one form or another, try to forget anything that involves strong negative emotions, stress,... Otherwise, a person simply won't survive... under our circumstances. And if the stress is great. Or maybe it's the global influences... geofactors... Or.

What about happiness? Which one of you is happier? By the way, there's a town not far away, and only zombies live there. What about wish fulfillment? Who's desire system and perception of reality are in a more harmonious relationship?

However, you are quite drowsy, young man. No, by external world I mean the world outside of a person, as opposed to their internal world. Although in some ways it can be compared to the Zone as well. So, what makes you so sure that everything you see and feel is actually happening, that your perception is in accordance with the surrounding reality and not induced by this very surrounding reality? Here's zombies for example - do you think they see the world the same way you do?

That depends on how you look at the question, young man. Once upon a time I worked in one of the famous institutes dealing with management problems, we had a modest laboratory there... Actually, what do you know about our perception of information from the outside world?

No, I'm certainly convinced that this is the real artifact... something that doesn't exist. But! In principle, its existence does not contradict my hypothesis about the interaction of complex geofactors, in the sum acquiring completely new properties, which are almost impossible to predict from the properties of the constituent objects of the system...

Yes... Once it was a big research camp, volunteers came here, equipment was delivered, but gradually we were forgotten. First, the influx of volunteers stopped - something in the outside world began to fail.

What's there to talk about when there's stuff going on here in the Zone... this is where every normal scientist should be. It's certainly a shame that there has been a complete cessation of any supply. Our lab has now moved to an autonomous existence. Young employees gradually began to go to other places, someone joined some clans, someone disappeared in the depths of the Zone, someone died trying to get an artifact. Some have become a sort of a legend in the Zone. Like the Mad Doctor, for example. He was one of the employees of one of the labs here in the Zone, but it was as if he had become part of the Zone. He developed characteristics not found in a normal person. No, he's not a mutant in the literal sense of the word, but there's something so special about him... They say he can reassemble stalkers crippled by the Zone literally from bits and pieces. Or even one of the remains of several. He's also supposedly able to communicate with zombies and even bring them back to normal. However, it is also said that he does this very rarely, as he believes that zombies do not want to return to normal life at all. We also had a guy named, uh. Journalist, I think. - He was obsessed with some sort of international conspiracy idea. All the time he was babbling about globalists, that brought in some kids...

They say there are some, but nobody really knows anything. I think there is such an order. They are trying to maintain the status quo. They are also called Angels of the Zone, or adherents of the monolith cult. They guard the center from which, according to rumors, the general management of all life in the Zone is carried out...
The personal PDA of a stalker nicknamed Goplit. Access is password-protected. Maybe one of the scientists can crack it.

...I didn't have time to do a write-up the day before yesterday. I came across the Journalist in the swamp nearby. I had to carry him back to his nest and help him to his feet. The Zuda I was saving for Toad had to be wasted. It's alright, it's not a pity about the Journalist. He said he was running away from someone, but when asked who exactly was chasing him, he preferred to keep silent. Bid him farewell today - he's scooted off somewhere up north. Where exactly and why - I don't know, but apparently he is going to meet his informants there. Before he left, he asked me if I had visited the archives of the local research institute. He was interested in some papers related to the delivery of equipment to the laboratory on Radar's territory. I'll be in the neighborhood to check it out. In case I find anything, I'll tell the Journalist when I meet him.
Fire-cooked rat. Much more nutritious than raw. Plus, the heat treatment killed all viruses and parasites.
Fire-cooked crow. Much more nutritious than raw. Plus, the heat treatment killed all viruses and parasites.
A box of matches. You can use it to start a fire. A campfire can be used to keep warm at night or in the rain, cook some food, and scare off hostile monsters.

...the Unified Consciousness experiments were a success. The linkage of the five prisoners yielded positive results. "United Consciousness" or "O-Consciousness had slightly less power than five times human intelligence. "O-Consciousness" awakened, showing frantic neuron activity and almost five times (compared to the human brain) the speed of information processing. The criminals' previously erased memory was being filled in again...[no data]...the precautions were insufficient. The researchers were not prepared for this kind of eventuality. Contact with one of the group's sedated bodies "O-Consciousness," two technicians and a nurse on the maintenance staff came under control. Next, the entire research block where the experiment was being conducted came under control with incredible speed. Instantly reacting, the experiment managers completely isolated the entire unit from the outside world. Deadly gas was pumped through the ventilation shafts. 28 controlled bodies were thrashing around in convulsions while O-Consciousness tried unsuccessfully to find an escape route. It was calculating escape options, scanning the bodies memory. They began to perish, but O-Consciousness had already discovered one-way windows through which a group of scientists were observing the effects of the experiment. With the help of strong telepathic influence, the group was brought under control and the O-Consciousness could hold nothing back anymore. The staff of the underground complex was taken under control, the power of O-Consciousness increased manifold. About 500 people are connected to the O-Consciousness...

Hmm. I don't really need artifacts, but I do need some parts. Tell you what, you get me a killer suit and a science suit. Plus a p90, and five bottles of vodka. Then I'll give it to you. I'll hold it for you. Or I'll give it to you for ten grand.

Relieve the effects of various kinds of psi radiation. It surpasses other benzodiazepine and abenzodiazepine tranquilizers by the strength of tranquilizing and anxiolytic (anti-anxiety) action; it also has a pronounced anticonvulsant, myorelaxant (muscle relaxant) and sedative effect.
Help cure the effects of a bite from an infected dog.
Servo power cell for the exoskeleton. To work, it is necessary to hang from the belt of the costume.

Made by the stalker Golmar and contains artifact particles. The anti-gravity flaps allow you to hover slightly above the ground. High and distance jumps have been increased. You don't have to worry about falling from 20 meters high. Load capacity +20 kg.
A false eye made of glass.
Engraved on the glass eye of a stalker nicknamed Phil was the code 667. You might want to remember that.
The code on Phil's glass eye.

The repairman in Bar offers to exchange the unique stalker suit named Golmar for the following items:
Killer suit
Scientific suit EX-04
P90 submachine gun
Five bottles of vodka.
Or ten thousand rubles.

Diary of a Dead Stalker. Some of the pages are blurred due to cadaverous decomposition, but some are readable.
02.04.2012 ...agreed to an expedition into the city. Maybe even highlight their science suit. In the meantime, I'll go like this, it's not a bad jacket. Oh, yeah, I remember, there's a locked room behind a closet in the ruins. When I'm in town, I should go in there. It's a little hard to move the closet, though.
03.04.2012 Got to Freedom Base. It was just Chrome and a couple of his security guys. He said that the zombies before the blowout in the city are beastly, and it's better to hide somewhere an hour or two before the start. Well, I'll keep that in mind.
02.04.2012, 23.40 Found that damn apartment the Professor said. Yeah, looks like one of them used to be here. A couple of units left. Anyway, I've changed the battery, and now I'm going to sleep here. Just as the door on the switch is still working.
03.04.2012, 03.14. Woke up to a knock on the door. Through the gap I spotted three zombies. They're breaking. Hopefully they'll be gone by morning at least.
03.04.2012, 08.45. They don't want to leave. They can smell it. Fucking hell, I'll try to get through.
03.04.2012, 12.31. Yeah, it's been a pretty bad day. One rotten one bit the jacket. The wound is covered in white foam. It sucks.
03.04.2012, 16.05 PDA's dead. Huh, I was gonna buy a spare battery from the Barkeep...
03.04.2012, 20.15 It's getting dark. Just this red light, and howling zombies. The wound hurts. Covered in sores. Why did I come here?
04.04.2012, 03.55. The door won't budge at all. And they're just standing there, waiting.
04.04.2012, 5.45. passed a couple of stalkers did not see shouted shooting head
 mapvyoshypych..yvf..fy.
Door's locked, looks like an electronic lock. A little give but it won't open. Looks like there were zombies in here.
A device with which you can lure out the intelligent swamp. To activate, you need to lay out the device in the desired area.
Zombie brain simulator, protects the wearer from the strong psi radiation of psionic monsters.
A box of ammo to give to Ferret.
A heavy backpack, presumably filled with artifacts. An orange glow runs through the fabric.

An old shabby diary found in the cab of a rusty radioactive diesel locomotive, which, by some unknown coincidence, turned out to be very far from the railroad. The decayed remains of what appeared to be the author of the diary were still found in the cabin. Judging from the records, he was trying to hide from the horrors of the Zone inside.\n"... There are still voices swirling around in my cranium. They don't want to come out. Asking to look out the window to see what's left. There's nothing there. Nothing. But I muffle them, because I'd go crazy if I looked out. It's empty. No color and no space. And who will survive when they see the void? No one. There's nothing there. There is only the room within me, and I within which is the room. There's nothing on the other side. Nothing at all. Sometimes I hear something creaking or growling on the other side. It's all a voice, a voice out of me. There's nothing out there. I crawl around the room so that God forbid I see a void. My body aches. The head, too. The geiger counter kept screaming. I blowout it into the void so it won't get in the way..."
Documentation of the installation at Lake Yantar

Documents found in an underground complex under Lake Yantar. They talk about starting work on an artificially grown biological psi emitter. The very first pages are filled with data on the arrival of biological materials: the dogs of the Pripyatchans, left after evacuation, or the wolves that have multiplied in the Chernobyl forests. However, if some records are to be believed, there were already doubts at that time that they would not be enough for long-term research, so the search for a new source of biomaterials was actively underway. In the appendices is a collective photo of the complex workers next to a life support device of a severed head from a dog. Some of the scientists' faces are censored. In the last pages there is a list of the first semi-annual shift of explorers, as well as a complete list of instructions for them, prescribed by the management.

PDA found near the MedPribor Institute by a military helicopter. Apparently, the handheld personal computer originally belonged to a pilot. The helicopter surveyed Cordon, the Garbage, Dark Valley and the vicinity of the Research Institute before hitting the anomaly and making an emergency landing. Many large sites in the south of the Zone are noted on the PDA. This data has not fallen into the hands of Perimeter Command and is unlikely to ever fall into the hands of Perimeter Command, so we can not be afraid of their further advancement deep into the Zone. You can try to transfer the marks made by the pilot to your PDA yourself - this information will certainly not be superfluous.

The leader of the Freedom faction, nicknamed Chrome, asked me to disable a psi device that the scientists had abandoned. According to him, the house where the scientists were located is in the southeast. At the same time, a cluster of super-strong radiation was detected in that area. So we need to prepare for it properly.
A screwcutter with strong gravitational properties. Experimental design.
The battery required to start the vehicle's engine.

There is no Monolith. No and never has been, Strelok. And you're the one who told me that when we were on the outskirts of Radar. Obviously, the Monolith is just another a psychotropic facility that was built as the last layer of defense. Defense ask who and from what? From stalkers, of course. But who organized the defense is already a mystery. You knew it, but you didn't have time to tell me. What do you think about the rumors of wish fulfillment, it's very hard to say. Someone may have gotten to the Sarcophagus and was able to make a wish at the Monolith. But more of these stalkers are alive No. They're probably getting a blowout caused by a wish they made. I don't know if there's any way-- to get to the bottom of whoever's behind this. After all, that's what we've been trying to do for a long time for you to find out. As far as I know, you were trying to get to them during that time outings, but, uh. you've become thrice-born. That's what the stalkers call you, right? Don't I know what went wrong then. Maybe the Monolith isn't the last line of defense? It can, there's another one and we didn't know about it? You know, uh. I believe there is another set up. There, behind the power plant. But where exactly is a mystery. It's also a mystery where the location from where the installation can be deactivated. In the meantime, I'm gonna try to get in touch with someone I've been I trust him completely to help me figure this out. You, Strelok, can to try to get into the Center Zone again. If I hear anything, I'll contact you.

You should know, Strelok, how many times I've told you this... I'm pre-Second Disaster in a settlement near the CEZ worked. Editorial. She was typing something for someone-- then, uh. I can't remember now what and to whom exactly - the Zone is almost everything erased my memories of the Big Land. I remember some yellow press where some of the articles personally sponsored by the mayor. And then it started, the first warning bells. let's go. Something's happened here with the military coming in such large numbers. It's just like I'm doing right now. I remember four truckloads of soldiers were brought into our village. A two-story headquarters in two days they've built, can you believe it? And the mayor's been pale all day. I went to Checkpoints - there are already barbed wire and mines at the entrances to the city... To all they refuse to answer questions, they say they're not supposed to answer. Even the Journalists. Yes, it is. they said. And then... From the neighboring village, the children left. All of them. At night, when my parents were asleep. There aren't even any babies left. The next morning, there's an uproar, moms are throwing themselves at the military. thought they'd taken the kids. The military didn't know what was going on. Or maybe it's just the sight didn't serve. So I went to that village. Already from our newspaper. Gathered the locals ask around, talk to internal affairs. Neither of them have anything don't remember. Completely. It's like everyone's memory has been erased. Not all of it, selectively. But about the kids, they're don't remember anything at all. Some couldn't even remember the name. The cops, of course, They blamed it on the vodka, because the people in that village drank a lot. But I've been talking to some acquaintances from there who are teetotalers... No, it wasn't a mass drinking party - kidnapping. What did I learn from them, you ask? Nothing useful. I had to wait. And I waited. Children they're starting to disappear from other townships. Same diagnosis-- no one remembers anything and. no one saw anything. Some were able to leave for another city out of fear for the child, and others and stayed in his home village, believing that no one could protect his child better. That's what everyone thought before the Second Catastrophe. The buses came, people started evacuating. You can't imagine the panic back then. They thought another reactor I did. Some of the old-timers have been around since eighty-six. They're the ones who remembered how The military arrived the day after the accident, and the evacuation was much more later announced. And in our case, things were even worse: the military had long ago and they didn't evacuate people until two months later. My neighbor, when I took him to the last time I saw him, he was calculating something. I asked people I know how he's been dosed I got it in time. We didn't know what really went on here in those days. And in me, it's just like then the thought occurred to me that if the kids went anywhere, it was to the Zone. There's no such thing there's no overlap between the two events. I decided one night, I'd sneak into the Zone. Just for one day, just to check things out. I was just before the military the first breakthrough to get there. I watched them all die in anomalies from afar. Part The APCs have been abandoned. The ones on the road to the center are often found. I went deep into the Zone and that's it. It's like the memories of the Big Land have been cut off by something. Slowly, so that I didn't notice. There's something left. Most important: name remembered, nickname, how to eat, drink, with a weapons to handle. I can still communicate with people, thankfully. And here's the title of our newspaper I can't remember. I can't remember what we have going on in the capital. What is it, events in the capital - I can't remember its name... It's possible, Is the Zone taking away our memories? Selectively, I think. Takes away some, and others fixes it so you can't get it out of your head. I remember I used to be a journalist was. I remember the village, my neighbor, the kids. And the same phrase keeps running through my head: find the children. I can't get any peace. And I'm not gonna rest until I find it. It's the Zone that's holding me back.
I can't go to the Big Land anyway, The zone is holding. And I know a lot about the Zone - about the labs, what's going on closer to Central. There's no turning back.

I know that shortly before the first day, all the children left the settlements near the borders. of the current Chernobyl Anomaly Zone. Gone to the Zone. They're probably in the center, on the other side of the Winds of Madness installation. In the South, all the places on the map but in the north, where there weren't so many people, there may well be. Something happened back there at the center that lured kids to the Zone. Just the kids, not adults. And that's what metamorphosed them here and turned them into dwarfs. - is already a mystery. I'm sure the center of the Zone was not without these labs.

It's hard to say. On the one hand, they're stalker tales that only newbies can get into Toad has faith. On the other hand, we are in the Zone, where anything is possible. Maybe you really are you are the Chosen One who can change the world.
One of the mobile science teams has gone missing in the Silent Hills area. We should try to find them, and if possible find out what happened to them.
A professor from the science compex on the lake asks for two strong gravitational artifacts to establish a business conversation.
Scientists from the group that researches Magnet Group artifacts require two such artifacts for further study.
Scientists from the group that is investigating the Magnet Group artifacts need two of these artifacts, plus the Electric Ball artifact, for further research.
Got some kind of result from a Magnet scientist in the form of an artifact. The task is to throw this artifact into an anomaly like Elektra, and bring the result back for study...
Another artifact order, but, here I was asked to get something special on top... Ammunition for the Gauss rifle. It looks like a normal cassette, with any number of charges.
That's a strange order... Should I bring a regular rifle for the scientists? What's this about...

And these nerds aren't so simple... working for the military. Well, military toys for the stalker cause are always useful... We need to fire a few hundred rounds from a prototype Vintorez with strong magnetic properties, and bring it back to them.

Documents from MedPribor Research Institute. It says on the cover that this is the main part of the documents, and somewhere is the application part. Inside, in addition to plans of storage rooms with hazardous biological materials and a list of the institute's personnel, one can find instructions from the head of scientific work: Due to the fact that some of the test subjects from the Department of Bio-breeding and Eugenics (Head of the Department - L. P. Romaniuk) represent a danger to the staff, the meeting decided to organize a storage of bio-waste unsuitable for further work. Pre-dead bio-waste that remains after experiments should be trucked away from the research areas to the disposal site (Rassocha Technique Cemetery). At the disposal site, the waste should be buried under layers of metal junk and rubble in abundance nearby. The railroad hangar is to be converted into a bio-waste storage facility for sorting. There is a high probability that these burials near the water body will cause a marked deterioration of the ecological situation in this region, so the collectors of the railroad shed should be brought to a suitable condition, for water filtration. All subsequent burial and water filtration directives were sent to the railroad facility management... \n Pencil marking - The first part of the control code is 65.

Documents from the Garbage. The cover has a black gel pen marking Personal to hand. Among the endless directives for troubleshooting the collector system and the list of warehouse personnel, which numbered about a hundred names, there are records of burials and the reception of bio-waste from research areas: A fresh batch of biological materials from MedPribor Research Institute has been received and is being transferred to our disposal. For the disposal of the waste, military personnel involved in guarding the warehouses north of the Rostok plant (approximately an hour's drive from the above facility) were engaged. Among other things, we had to ask for five more trucks from the storage garages to transport the waste because the previous vehicles were already dirty and not suitable for further use, so they will be disposed of at our landfill. For the new machines, everything has already been agreed, the documents have been signed, and copies of the documentation are in the archive in the main warehouse building. The original documents will be sent to the NRI archives next week. \n Pencil marking - The second part of the control code is 76.

Documents from MedPribor Research Institute. It says on the cover that this is the application part of the documents, and somewhere is the main part. Almost nothing interesting except that these documents are signed by the technical director of site security after the Second Catastrophe: After the increase of anomalous activity in the region and loss of communication with a number of northern laboratories (Complex zx-06, Laboratory Center, zx-10), the management of the Research Institute decided to evacuate the personnel and preserve the Institute. Any attempt to escape from the regime territory will be punishable by death. All instructions have already been issued to the site security to deal with trespassers. She should dispose of all bio-materials of the research on site to avoid leakage. Further transportation of bio-waste to the Rassokha burial ground for further burial follows. Check the Institute's archive for compromising data and destroy it before the troops arrive. After all procedures for the conservation of the facility have been carried out, Institute personnel should break through to the Laboratory Center, regardless of the anomalous activity in its region to stabilize the experiment and eliminate its consequences. \n Pencil marking - The third part of the control code is 82.

Papers from Silent Hills. Copies. The originals may have been destroyed long ago. Beneath the cover are electroencephalogram readings with notes made in black marker. Next to the results of the graphical record is a trip report to a research facility on one of the islets in Lake Yantar. No irregularities were observed during the demonstration of the operation of the ZX-08 biological unit with a unique (to date) sample of artificially grown biomass (sample Y-1M). The research department took every precaution in activating the facility: the attendees were given level one safety spacesuits and medical supplies with ampoules of psi-blocker drugs (in case the demonstration got out of hand). The 1269-bis subjects were exposed to surface psi radiation. Any attempts to impede his control were blocked on a mental level. Fields with multidirectional acceleration vectors (gravity concentrates) were tested on the same subjects. The results of the experiment are recorded on tape. A copy of the tape could not be obtained, so it is currently archived at the research complex. Among other things, recordings of previous experiments and demonstrations are also there. \n Pencil marking - The fourth part of the control code is 27.

Papers from Lake Yantar. A thick folder stuffed with scientific documents. Clearly of value to someone who understands the endless stream of dry numbers, graphs and schematics of the transmitter device. Beneath a layer of papers that have partially turned to dust, there is a tape recording of the tests being performed. It's impossible to view it without the necessary equipment. There is also a letter to the head of the Center lab that apparently was never sent to the recipient.
"Recently demonstrated to our dear guests the workings of an artificially grown biological psi emitter. Everything went well, no comments were received. We are ahead of schedule and have almost overtaken the Kaymanov emitter in power. To do that, truth be told, we had to increase the bio-mass by about a quarter using test biological material, which meant we'd have to go back to Pahlo for everything we needed. Please talk him into another shipment of prisoners from his colony. Subjects for Rainbow are supplied uninterruptedly and on demand, while for our laboratory they have to beg! As if to spite me. I know we're not going to run out of this resource anytime soon, so don't talk about limitations. Speaking of which, was at their demo recently, in the staff room by the main emitters. The trial information is there, so I suggest you familiarize yourself with it sometime too. Caymanoff just recently had a cooling problem with the rig there. Says it's all about nitrogen tanker leaks. For that matter, ask him what's in there. He'll tell you all about it, ha ha." 
 Head of Laboratory ZX-52, Pavel Stepanovich Prikhodko.
Pencil marking - Fifth part of control code - 18.

Radar files. Somebody ripped out the title page, but all the rest is in place. Each page is stamped "classified" and signed "D. M. Kaimanoff". At the very bottom of the folder is an envelope. The addressee is still the same Cayman. "Dmitri Mikhailovich, how could it be so, eh? After all, you promised that there would be no more escapes of biological material. We supply them to your lab on short notice, and you lose them. Found one at MedPribor not too long ago. Be thankful they still gave it back to you instead of giving it to Prikhodko or giving it back to Pakhlo. By the way, I heard that Prikhodko keeps threatening to file a complaint against you. For failing to follow safety procedures during an extreme demonstration. They say the drugs were not given to everyone, there are holes in the defense. And this installation of yours is, quote, "no good at all - a total cost of equipment and cooling system". What's suspicious is that your staff performance reports say the exact opposite. I'll stop by after the Center's installation test - I'll look into it personally. And last but not least. I heard a rumor that you're losing your papers again on your trip to Pripyat. For the second time in six months. The first time wasn't enough for you? You'll pick them up personally from the Pripyat school. How and when doesn't interest me." Vadim Mikhailovich Chubko\nPencil marking - The fifth part of the control code is 05.

Documents from Pripyat. They should have been covered in a thick layer of dust the whole time they'd been here, but someone had leafed through them and made notes with a pencil not too long ago. The last entry was a short time ago, "Strelok, I'll be in Freedom group territory. Find me in one of the houses on the outskirts of town. I'll be waiting. Glad you're back. Hurry up. Journalist." This entry was on top of an old notebook whose owner had previously used it as a personal diary:\
"Strange place they chose for the installations. The soil is completely unusable and terribly radioactive. We had to wear spacesuits, which are usually worn by Chernobyl personnel, to avoid grabbing a large dose. Even now, sitting in the break room, I don't want to take the food offered here. It's a good thing no one's gonna bother you here. Vadim Mikhailovich gave a full tour of the Center laboratory. Described the working principle of the plant and its objectives. The sheer scale of it is truly mesmerizing, and my emitter is no match for it. I was particularly struck by its surface generators. We were not allowed to get close to them - the background near them is just off the scale. It's scary to think what the future holds for those who are setting these generators to work now. Or their descendants. Vadim Mikhailovich demonstrated the operation of the plant. For this purpose, ten laboratory employees, including Vadim Mikhailovich himself, had to be involved. From the observation post we watched what was happening. Vadim Mikhailovich kept bragging that he would catch God by the beard. This time he didn't just grab it, he ripped it out by the root." \n Pencil marking - The fifth part of the control code is 88.
Extract from Kiev branch of laboratory No. 15

In person. To the head of the strict regime 1269 bis Pakhlo K.P.\nKirill Petrovich, again I address you with a request. I'm interested in a sheep from your farm. Index: 115. V. D. Krivoshein. Would like to get his dossier soon, and preferably himself. They are willing to give a little more for this frame than for an individual prisoner, but this time already after receiving a copy. Leave transportation to us again - your men are already getting suspicious at the checkpoint.
Prof. Chubko V. M.
I have no idea where you got the lists of our prisoners, but I have to say in advance that I don't want to know. I can't attach the dossier from the archive - there will be a check the other day, so I'll write here the basic data: Viktor Davidovich Krivoshein, born in 1968. Organizer and chief ideologue of the Grey Brothers religious group. The group was engaged in sectarian activities. Occasional cases of fatal robbery and cannibalism have been seen among the sect members. Here since 1996, life imprisonment. Krivoshein is undergoing psychotherapy sessions, but the prognosis from our psychologists is disappointing. I'll try to forward this frame to you as soon as possible.
Yours sincerely, Warden of Maximum Security Unit 1269 bis, Palo K.P.
P.S. From myself I will add the following: there is practically no data about Krivoshein's past in the dossier. However, I was able to learn from my sources that before the religious organization came into existence, he worked in some institute that dealt with the problems of self-government. Probably, after the collapse of the USSR, the institute was closed, and the biography of the employees was "cleaned up". Well, I don't need to tell you about that.
P.S. 2. The "tops" are still trying to hush up the story of that march of the "brothers" in the capital so that no one would remember it. I assume you remember this event...

We are very far away from HIS black blinding radiance. His call is heard, but, in truth, not as much as it is in the North, in HIS domain. We're holed up in some basement. We try to go outside as little as possible. The brothers say that in this city one should never go out into the main square because the arrows of the infidels dot the roofs of the city. Someday the mighty fist of the Monolith will reach here as well, bringing us triumphant victory. In the meantime, all we have to do is bring in reinforcements. The second group should be here soon, which will at least increase our presence in this sector a bit. About five minutes ago, Big Brother had warned me that it would soon be necessary to descend into the city's sewers, from where we could strike at the heretics in the Cooptorg building. But before that, we'll have to deal with the man-eating rats that infest the sewer.

A spring-loaded notebook found on the corpse of a stalker in the Garbage. Only the first third of the notebook was scribbled, the rest of the sheets were left untouched. Judging by the abrupt ending of the entries, death caught up with the stalker as he was making his last journal entry.\nThe ferret is a cattle dog. You can't trust him, I'll tell the Barkeep that when I get to the bar. Said everything was quiet at the Garbage, just kilometers of iron and anomalies. No shit. The brothers are still on their way to get stomped. I had to share my loot. They left me with a bare ass. How am I supposed to go to MedPribor now? I'm gonna kill myself if I don't get the papers. I guess I'll have to go to the bar first to get a gun, and then...
Power knuckles. The design utilizes elements of a strong gravitational artifact.
Special PDA of a member of the military science team. Basic artifact information is available, as well as encrypted coordinates.

The Gravity Glove is a new experimental weapon that deals damage using the forces of gravity. Developed by scientists based on the theory of gravitational fields. Can attract and repel objects, acts through walls. The distance limit is 30 meters. The closer the object, the stronger the effect of the glove.
Opportunities: 
1.Abruptly pull an object toward you. 
2.Hit and push an object

A checkered notebook found in the glove compartment of a truck. Its previous owner ripped out the first pages for some reason, so it is impossible to find out when exactly he started keeping the diary. Judging by the earliest surviving date, he was engaged in transportation of equipment and personnel even before the second disaster. Among the invoices and equipment lists are the coordinates of some laboratories that exchanged information and biological materials among themselves. The last entry was two years ago: Military stalkers have been opening fire on every car since the Death Trucks showed up. That sucks. Picked up some stalker at their base, got caught when those freaks noticed him. Lucky - I still can't figure out how I heard it. Introduced himself as Strelok. I thought I'd take him to the scientists' camp, where he'd be back on his feet in no time, but he didn't trust the scientists, as it turned out. He said, "Take me to the doctor."
A regular handheld flashlight. Does not require recharging. Can be used as a weapon.
To complete the experiment, this anomalous formation must be thrown into an Elektra-type anomaly.
The result of the effect of the Electra anomaly on the subject of the experiment. We need to give it to him for further research.
An old SVT-40 bayonet, rusted and pitted due to age and exposure to the elements - but still deadly.
I think you need a surge protector to get through.
Toad: Don't go there now. This place is dead, the level of PSI activity is off the charts. I warned you, stalker.
Remembered some code... 3781... Seems to be in some kind of tunnels... Rostok?

What? We don't do that. Where did you get this information? Although, maybe whoever told you that meant the camp on the marshes. There's quite often a helicopter with equipment there. It's not working right now, though, because of the high psi radiation.

According to the directive of the Central Committee of the CPSU, the territories within the unconditional mandatory resettlement zone (hereinafter referred to as the CRZ) within a radius of ten kilometers from the site of the accident, as well as a number of infrastructure facilities and dual-use cities (Jupiter plant, Chernobyl-2, Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant named after M.V. Lomonosov, Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, and the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant), were to be resettled within a radius of ten kilometers from the site of the accident. Lenin, Yantar complex) together with all documentation are transferred under the management of the governmental organization MOST (Ministry of Defense and Secret Technologies). The primary goals of the above facilities at the beginning of 1987: to conduct projects "Sky-2", "Cover", development of means of psychotropic defense and attack, genetic research, tests in the field of vortex flows and electromagnetic anomalies in various areas of the world and development of new types of energy. A decision was made to conduct the first test launch of the RD-100 special-purpose unit (aka "Russian Woodpecker", Zagorizontnaya Radar Power plant "Duga") under conditions of increased radiation environment.
You can get some kind of liquid in here.

Wow! A local legend, here in my workshop! Oh, well. I'm Amethyst. I'm in the gun and gear repair business. You know it's not so good here, that's why I decided to join the environmentalists. And I've always hated going to landfills and cemeteries... So you need something fixed?
Water sample from the swamp at the MedPribor Research Institute.
Water sample from the NII swamp
Toad ordered a water sample from the swamp at the MedPribor Research Institute. He said there must be a suitable container in the factory.
Digger needs an anomaly detector. Charged. He said there's one stashed on the roof of the factory somewhere. He said something about some stalker with an eye patch. Sounds like bullshit... though.
Concentrate anomaly Studen. When a vessel is broken, a new anomaly is formed.
Observations on changes in the hierarchy of recessive traits

Vadim Mikhailovich, we continue to conduct tests as normal. We are waiting for you at our farm to admire the results of recent tests. We are already testing breeds with introduced "wild" genes. In the attachments to this letter, you can take a look at photos of some of the specimens: you can already clearly see the changes in the musculoskeletal system and the physiology of the sensory system. I also recommend looking at the results of experiments to transplant the pituitary gland of the African "hyena" into our wolves. Amazing, isn't it? By the way, yesterday I. G. Uralov suggested that we should already proceed to transplantation of human pituitary gland, but I had to give up this adventure. I'm sorry, I don't have a qualified Preobrazhensky here yet. Where experienced staff are on a different level of our sixth lab. And the human pituitary gland, Vadim Mikhailovich, is no joke! However, I refused to refuse, but I will not say that this idea will go into a drawer for a long time. In the future, we plan to move on to much more serious experiments. It is very unfortunate that the unit you have allocated does not allow for a full range of long term concentrated gravity treatments. It just doesn't have enough power. Get it right: other departments get 20% more energy. Even Makarov's department consumes more, even though he has only three lab technicians on staff and they only do accounting. If you would be so kind, Vadim Mikhailovich, increase the lab's power supply. Tell your people at the plant to get the new fourth reactor up and running within a month. Believe me, it will speed up the work process. Head of the Department of Biological Breeding and Eugenics, L. P. Romaniuk 15.04.1986
The conversion requires: Strong gravitational artifact and Strong Needles.

Listen, we got a case for you. Have you heard of the Monolithians? They're local fanatics. They believe a crystal or monolithic block from space fell on the roof of the power plant. Guys say that no one can come closer than 30 meters to them, or they immediately start shooting...

Anyways... our sharpshooters started spotting them on the road to the Swamps. This is no good, I can feel it. I suspect they've got a staging area somewhere up there by the road to the Swamps. You should go see what's out there. but, you know, we're not really in conflict , we don't touch each other, but we're still fucking bigots. There's no guarantee they won't attack us tomorrow... See if you can find where they've settled. Snipers passed on that their main activity is usually at night, so I think after midnight there's a chance of catching them...

You saved my hide again. What's the second time? I've lost count, frankly. Okay, now for the main point. I'm never coming back to this house again. Information has surfaced that the military has exits to this city. Which means that now I will definitely not be left alone after our joint "business" in the Valley. Rumor has it that some merchants are doing business with the army, which means it's not safe for me to be in the city. We'll have to leave the shelter and move north.
