I'd advise you to move somewhere away from the suburbs, too. But knowing you and your appetite for trouble, I realize that my advice will pass your ears. Those documents we got in the Valley give some insight into the situation around the international research center in the Zone. Until recently, this center did exist, but what has become of it now is unknown. Perhaps it still exists today. We need to find him, Strelok. Unfortunately, I don't have any more information about this center. The eggheads from Yantar couldn't say anything - they blamed it all on signatures on non-disclosure and release of state secrets. By the way, if you get a chance, I suggest you drop in on an old acquaintance in the Swamps. He asked me to tell you that he got the medicine you asked for from the scientists. Be careful out there. Stalkers in the bar say that after the extreme emission there psi radiation is prohibitive. Take the other trail. Take care of yourself, for the Zone's sake. Journalist

Personnel: 1,245.
Of which: 763 are official military personnel; 16 are military stalker guides.
Support: 45 Armored Personnel Carriers (BTR-70), 8 T-64 tanks, 3 Mi-24 helicopters.
Main route: equipment graveyard - City - Old Storages - Pripyat - Power plant - F12L area.
Reserve: equipment cemetery - City - Lake Yantar - G. Free Way - Pripyat - Power plant - F12L area.
Digression: not provided.
Ambient: There may be previously unknown anomalies closer to the F12L area. Resistance: unknown. The discovery of the remains of the first exploring expedition is likely.
Objective: to break through to the epicenter of the Zone and destroy the cause of the deadly anomalous fields. Stop the growth and expansion of the Zone's anomalous fields. Locate those involved in the creation of the Zone.
2009.05.13.
Part of the plans and maps of one of the lost detachments of the military expedition

The state commission found no violations during its inspection of the science facilities. The Commission concluded to issue a permit for extension of research works on the territory of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone not later than 02.06.1998. Currently, the scientific research institute "MedPribor" (see Annex ** for a breakdown of activities) is developing equipment for complex devices used in radiation oncology. From the technical data, it appears that the device will be in high demand for patients with "tumor cordis, casus inoperabilis". The main advantages of the new equipment: increased safety measures for both the patient and the treating physician during the procedure, record speed of one irradiation procedure. In this regard, we ask to withdraw the research documents from the Central Archive and transfer them to the file cabinet of the Research Institute "MedPribor" to optimize the reporting work.

... The first reports of missing children from the village, which is close to the perimeter of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, were received by the Ivankivka District Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs only the next morning. Neither the distribution of orientations nor the help of volunteers yielded promising results. It was decided by the rescue team coordinators to triple the search area. "In case the missing children are not found within three weeks, the search will have to be called off," the leader of a group of volunteers in Sector A8 warns us.
\nLaw enforcement officials have suggested that children may have traveled to the CEZ, but cordon commanders say that no persons under the age of majority have been recorded in the vicinity of the thirty-kilometer perimeter. In response to the lead coordinator's request for permission to search for the children on the territory of the CEZ, the perimeter command refused, citing the territory's closed military regime. Photos, first and last names can be seen on the last page. The editorial board of the newspaper "Echo of Chernobyl" according to the rescue group is offering a cash reward for any information on the whereabouts of the missing children that will help the search.

You've been to the factory before, right? They say it's notorious among stalkers, and that anyone who climbs into the attic will have bad luck. At the Garbage, a guy with an eyepatch even said that a legendary stalker once got betrayed and died there.

Yeah, well, yeah. It's up to you in the big picture... but I need a simple anomaly detector. I heard there's one hidden in the attic of the factory. Unless, of course, it's already been stolen. If you get it, I'll give you a new 9x18. It's up to you, kid, to go there or not to go there.
The door! Close the door. This isn't a passageway.
What are you, drunk? Get down from there!

To the Head of Kiev Branch of Laboratory No. 15, Karteevich I. L.\ Ivan Lvovich, after conferring with the rest of the group, we have unanimously approved an offer to give you a sample of the anomalous body, as you requested. The body itself is dangerously close to the infamous Helena cap, due to the than it is difficult to study it on site. What we've been able to discover about the nature of the crystal is described below. We send you a sample container. Labeling container: "Monolith 2."\n*** \n Found in the bowels of Unit 4, a body of anomalous nature has no no analogs with officially (and unofficially) known to modern science alloys. Psi radiation levels range from ~1200 to ~1500 Jigowatts, which is dangerous for the life of anyone who comes within ten meters of it. In addition to that, we discovered a peculiarity in the behavior of the crystal: the creation of organic and of inorganic substances from literally nothing...

In the personal diary of a stalker-hunter found very interesting notes on the habits of mutant bloodsuckers:\
Entry 1: From the description of the extreme raid into the Silent Hills: Followed Bull's group from afar. The big man and the rookies entered the village. Usually knowledgeable people avoid this place, knowing its inhabitants. Very carefully, trying not to make a sound, the stalkers walked around the crumbling wall of the water tower. They came to a low spot between two hills. There they noticed bodies lying around. They carefully moved closer. In front of them was a gruesome sight: disfigured corpses that belonged to two stalkers. The impression of the bodies was as if not only blood, but all the insides had been drained out of them, leaving only the skin, the outer shell. The stunned stalkers staggered back to cover. Meanwhile, from behind, a tall mutant with huge outgrowths on its muzzle silently jumped down from the five-meter wall. His sickle-shaped arms opened to embrace Bull, who stood closer to him. The thug's back felt someone's presence. He abruptly recoiled and turned around at the same time. Too late - sickle-shaped hands with long fingers and strange suction cups on their palms grabbed his abruptly collapsed body. Fainting, the stalker notices a creepy face, with ugly outgrowths instead of a mouth, approaching his neck. The rookies managed to run away with ghastly screams, leaving their mentor to die. They didn't get far - the frightened stalkers ran right out into the anomaly field...

Entry 2: Bloodsucker. High humidity and darkness create all the conditions necessary to live and hunt. Skin-eating mucus retains its main properties only in a moist environment. Since the bloodsucker has a thermoregulation system at the primitive level of frogs, its metabolism is slow, depending on the air temperature. The best climate for a bloodsucker is high humidity and temperatures above 17-18'C. The bloodhound is a nocturnal animal, the retina of its eye has more cones than the human retina of a human being, allowing it to see in the dark and twilight better than in the daytime. In the dark, his pupils are understandably dilated, so in the light of a flashlight a retina is visible: the so-called red-eye effect.
 Record 3: Possible habitat identified:
 Dungeons:
1. Caves 2. Underground corridors 3. Basement Surface:
1. Wastelands 2. Dumps Premises:
1. Factory premises 2. House premises 3. waste storage facilities 4. Paddocks Anomalous zones:
1. Radiation hotspots 2. Fog.
Entry 4: An interesting subject for zoologists are the tentacles on the snout. Presumably these are modified mouth organs - tongue, cheeks and mandible. The bloodsucker's mouth cavity disappeared, splitting into tentacle-like branches. They serve several functions. Basically, it is a sensory organ and part of the oral apparatus. As a sensory organ, the tentacles are analogous to the bifurcated tongue in reptiles. Their surface is heterogeneous and on the inner (mouth) part is dotted with many receptors - this is one of the most sensitive areas in the bloodsucker. On the inner surface are located their mucous glands. The internal structure of the tentacles corresponds to their functional purpose, i.e. it is permeated with blood vessels and nerves. It also has three layers of musculature, allowing the bloodsucker to utilize them as it feeds. When in a relaxed state, the tentacles sway and pick up odors in the air.

An old yellowed notebook with notes that deal with the first military expeditions to the Zone. Most of the pages are bloodstained or missing altogether. In some places, the handwriting is impossible to make out.
 Recording 3. 15.03.2007
 ... The evacuation of civilians from the village took longer than the perimeter leadership had originally anticipated. We're missing five residents. They're all in their mid-twenties. According to eyewitness accounts, an hour after the ''incident'' the old men took off northward. The major strictly forbade to send the group after them...
 Record 5. 16.03.2007
 ... We came to a graveyard of radioactive equipment. Lost two boxes along the way. The first one somehow ducked into the curb and all the electronics failed. The second one suddenly stopped in the middle of the road at the entrance to the dump. There are rumors among officers that the enemy is using electromagnetic weapons and disabling our equipment to delay us. The question is: who is the enemy...?
 Record 11. 19.03.2007
 ... The major has gone completely off the rails - he suggests that we fortify ourselves in the city and wait there for reinforcements. Communication with the command is impossible - the radio is dead. Vasiliev had been working on it for two hours already; the major gave him a hard slap for his careless attitude to the radio. The scouts went north to the old warehouses. They say there may be survivors.
 Record 17. 21.03.2007
 ... We finally found Vasiliev. Locked himself inside in one of the houses on the second floor. Had to break down the door to get to him. Hung himself. The scouts still haven't returned - the Major is already going to send more men after them. Vasyan offered to volunteer. Says we need to make a detour and go out to the Perimeter. I agreed.
Unknown anomalous formation. It floats a bit in the air, while being quite heavy.
SOS: Come in! Somebody help me, I'm out here in the woods behind the muck!
Professor: No reception, stalker. All questions to our assistant in the annex next to the bunker.

Goplit, stalker, cordon rookie in trouble. He seems to be a longtime resident here and may be able to share information. In order to bring him to his senses you need to give him 2 black needle artifacts or 5 regular needle artifacts. I think that will be enough.
Turn on the second floor lights
Turn on the first floor lights
Shit. Clearly not worth sticking around for too long... and where are all these scientists?
Removable rechargeable battery for PDAs. You can use it to find out the current charge of your portable computer.
A heavy crate of equipment for the scientists' camp at Lake Yantar.

A saffiano-covered file, the owner was obviously a high-ranking man. Inside data on special equipment deliveries to the XZ-09 laboratory. Probably worth a pretty penny. Reports on the observation of the results of experiments 1) Implementation of the psycho-emotional correction unit in the settlement of employees of the Atomic Power plant was successful. Increases in productivity, efficiency and stamina have been observed among Chernobyl Power plant employees. Psychotherapists have noted a decrease in emotional intensity. It is true that the contingent complains of a sharp decline in general commutative manifestations. The version with the consequences of exposure to ionizing radiation is considered official. 2) Surveillance report on the contingent of long-term residents of the territories with radiation background that does not always coincide with the established norms. Unscheduled gene mutations were seen among the test subjects. Suddenly, previously recessive traits became dominant, which affected production level performance. The observation of new daughter specimens was decided to be handed over to the reserve group. Observation of maternal specimens is ongoing.
Stalker, if you come near us, we will open fire. Go away.

The scientist at the science complex on Yantar refuses to let me into the Professor's bunker because of some personal problem. His wife disappeared in a lab under the Dark Valley. Clearly he wants the pendant that he said he gave her... Do I go looking for that pendant, or do I send that asshole back there?
Toad: Lost contact with one of my couriers near an abandoned village. I don't know where he disappeared to. Do me a favor and find him.

Yeah, well, what did you think? We have explosives, I think. We've been planting some land mines here. But I can see you have an interest in the house. Okay, here's the deal. Can you get me an artifact called a disintegrator, preferably a whole one. And one Zuda, I hear it's good for your health. If you bring the good stuff, I'll assign you our bomb squad to do it. Well, if you're tight on artifacts, fine, I'll take 10 grand from you and deal.
The leader of the Freedom faction asks for a Disintegrator and Zuda artifact or a payment of 10,000 for blowing up the door where the Psi Weapon scientist lived.
An empty jar of special glass into which the substance of the Studen anomaly can be typed.
On the approach to the bar came a message from Witcher asking for a meeting...
A scientist in Bar asked me to find any information about his missing brother, who worked there, at the Rostok factory. Promised a suit for helping me find it.
Spread the chain! It's about to start! According to intelligence, the lair of the blind dogs was supposed to be in that hollow over there... Stalker! Get over here quick, we need your help!

An experimental sample of an anti-radiation drug designed to protect the human body from alternative types of radiation contamination. The time of action is no more than a few tens of minutes, depending on the expiration date.\nServes as a treatment for radiation sickness.
It's a strange kind of artifact Pee Wee. It's stuck to the backpack wall. It gives off a faint greenish glow.

Not much, believe me. You know, the device is a rare thing. Not every soldier is eager to share it. So..., works in autonomous mode, the charge is enough for... for quite some time. If you need another one, come on over. Just don't forget the money.

Decided to raid the NRI with our local landmark from the truck of death... and why not? He even got me a gravity gun to go with it. It's good stuff. The main thing is not to forget where I left the spare scientist from the last raid, or it's a research institute... okay. I hid it in the cab of the locomotive, I think I'll remember it as soon as I see it... the main thing is that no one stole it when I came...
Toad: I don't recommend going there, it's a scary place. I can't believe how loud it's buzzing. Although sometimes some gangsters came from there, local kids, they hung out here, over the bridge.
Toad said a stalker from the death truck came by looking for me. I need to find him in the swamp, he's obviously in one of the huts. Maybe he remembers something and can clarify things.
You have to remember to keep your pda charged... especially in raids.

Stalker Duty in the bar offers to exchange ammunition, and other things, such as gasoline for vodka... You can find him at their base at night, or in its vicinity, and negotiate a barter... However, it's unclear how this may yet end...
A regular Dream brand cigarette. Smoking is bad for you, but temporarily tones you down a bit.

I need a weak gravity...and a medium, I mean regular one too. Probably seen these before. You bring it in, I'll take it back at a higher price. And if you get both of them, I'll make you an extra one from me.
A detector for measuring anomalous activity. To make measurements it is necessary to take the device in your hands and activate it near the source of anomalous energy.
Drinking water, helps quench thirst. Produced clearly out of the zone.

I'm going to tell you a story I tell everyone. It's the legend of the Monolith, quite that may have caused the Zone. In 2006, the Zone exploded, there were measures were taken and the population in the district was evacuated, the Zone was cordoned off by army units. No one's knew what was going on, panic all around, the Zone was growing, the field labs were powerless. Heap people died inside. Everyone is afraid of radiation that could cover half of Europe.

A few years went by, the first desperate guys like you showed up. They called themselves stalkers. They penetrated the army cordons, believing that there was something in the Zone, and it was something that can bring them wealth, fulfill their desires. Slowly we started dragging strange things out of there, artifacts that were instantly chased. Scientists went crazy over these things. For one such sample they paid mad money, no the way it is now. And so, the first stories and legends emerged about what was in the inside the Zone, near a dilapidated nuclear power plant. One of the veterans retold the story, heard from one of the local old-timer stalkers, a story about the Monolith, supposedly a the wish-granting one. What hysteria ensued, stalkers huddled together in groups and to the center of the Zone, each wanting something from the Monolith. The gloomy ones appeared details of the first stalker to reach Monolith. Back when the Zone first came along, a lot of people were trapped, cut off from the outside world.

Most perished, but there were rare lucky ones who not only survived, but also trying to do something about it. One of the survivors ended up near the power plant, inside he saw a strange glow. He had no choice, the way back was cut off, and he was got closer. A picture was revealed to him-the pierced roof of the sarcophagus, illuminated by the from the inside. He climbed the wall and the insides of the Sarcophagus were revealed before him. There, amid piles of metal debris and charred concrete pancakes, rested a huge a black block of geometric shape. That was the Monolith. Stalker woke up to a strange and realized he'd climbed into a Sarcophagus that stinks to high heaven. The horror restrained him, and the call of the Monolith monotonously pierced through the fear. The monolith called out to him, and at the the stalker's hair stood on end. Strange, creepy things were exploding in his head pictures of the alien. We don't know what's in of this story, true or false.

The point is, he made a wish and it came true, and the Zone increased dramatically by five kilometers. It seems that for every execution the Zone's desire to eat our Earth. But that doesn't stop the stalkers. They're continue to tear inward, carrying their deepest desires to the Monolith...

There's a lot of rumors about this thing, the Monolith thing. And rumors of all kinds. Some stalker told me that the Monolith is a sort of... What did he say? The basis of all human aspirations and desires, is it? Something unique to which man strives... Quin-tez-sen-tsi-yah, fuck... He said a lot of clever things back then - I can't remember everything. I wasn't really listening - I wished he'd just shut up and get out get the hell out of the basement. He was right about something. Everyone aspires to the Monolith. Rumor has it that is something of extraterrestrial origin. I heard he landed near the Sarcophagus, or the roof blew through the roof and into reactor four, yeah. That's why a lot of people they think he's the reason the Zone came into existence.

It was all of a sudden... the partner died right before my eyes in a split second... he literally burned from the inside out... what was that? And that call-- something was calling me-- I'll have to tell Toad about it when I get to his bunker.

A small pile of papers with some drawings and calculations. -the impact zone of the plant in the city area is approximately several tens of kilometers, depending on the power supplied... - The mobile versions of units 2 and 3 are currently inactive, unit 3 is still in the scientist camp as far as I know.

Heard a broadcast on an ancient radio. Probably from the Big Land, which is sometimes mentioned by other stalkers. I don't know if they were telling the truth on the air or lying; if it was an old tape or a live feed, but I can't believe what I'm hearing. ...no real basis for a serious worries. ...temporary measures... ... decisive actions... ...drastic changes... ...it's certainly too early to talk about accomplishments biological minimum... It feels like that the Big Land is as messed up as the Zone... if not worse. You have to wonder if God exists. Earth, really? I've probably been there. In my past. What if I wasn't? Maybe there's no Big Land? Then where do stalkers come from, and where is this broadcast coming from?
Refuel the generator (a can of gasoline is required).
Toad: Stalker! You're near the Yantar crossing now. Don't go in there now unless you want your brains to turn into mush.
Stalker! You're near the Silent Hills crossing now. Don't go in there now unless you want your brains to turn into mush. Keep this in mind.
Stalker! You're near the Yantar crossing now. Don't go in there now unless you want your brains to turn into mush.

We're scientists, we're interested in everything that happens here. So, as I said, the mutant is quite rare in these parts, but recently a group of freedom fighters that is in the dead city of Shining Path noticed one such individual wandering in the vicinity of the destroyed apartment buildings. And it is this one that is of particular interest to us. It's been spotted-- but that's beside the point. You see, our group is small in number, and we need to collect material, so you must capture this mutant for us. We need live tissue samples, so we can't kill the monster. Say lock it up somewhere in one of the apartments in town, or any other suitable place. Alright, go ahead, stalker.
That's it, and now I need a drink. Come over later.

PDA stalker group Last Day. Last entry -...the world is heading for the end of the world... the Zone's territory will soon expand many times over. Several countries will find themselves in the Zone, whose populations will not have time to evacuate... data error...we track down zombified stalkers, study psi radiation, develop theories about psychotropic weapons and how they work. It is necessary to send agents, as the target is extremely difficult to reach, even though they can penetrate outside the zone.

Caught rabies from a dog bite. You're lucky you had a chance to heal. You have to be careful with dogs from now on, it turns out these things are not as harmless as you might think at first glance. I bet most of them are infected with this virus... and the virus is insidious. The symptoms occur spontaneously and not immediately.
Stalker, get in the house. I need help.
Don't shoot. I won't hurt you unless you want me to.
You're not human. How can you talk?
There was when what... talk... it's no problem... stalker, you wouldn't happen to have anything to eat, would you?
A stalker's jumpsuit completely worn out and turned to dust.

Found a man to go to the NRI together. We need to get a costume for him though, otherwise he won't go. Toad said he had one, but in return he asked to deal with a certain mutant in the village beyond the bridge. Well, what else is left?

Toad promises a new scientific suit suitable for trips to research institutes and especially radiation-contaminated zones. We need to check out a railroad embankment with a fallen train lying next to it.
The radioactive house behind the bridge

I got my hazmat suit, Toad noticed it right away. Asked me to get something just as phoned in from the house that's as phoned in as a reactor. The suit is supposed to protect against radiation, but you need to check the condition first. If there is a lot of wear, you should not climb inside it.

Found a strange case on the tower... there are dead bodies nearby, practically bones already. Probably some kind of scientific expedition or something. Toad showed interest, but I decided to keep him...for now. Said to talk to a certain Informant at the bar.
I met a stalker named Phil at the Garbage. Asked me to get him his false eye. He says that it's with a stalker at the Duty checkpoint on the northern part of the dump.
The strange rookie at the rock asks to take his AK74 by force from the bandits. That's a nice weapon. Maybe I should keep it, send it out, or-- or--
A psi-damage shielding device for the Dark Valley. Doesn't save you from exposure to strong radiation. Used by military stalkers as well as veteran stalkers.
The barrel from the radioactive house. The sign on the side says hazardous materials.
Anomaly Discharger. Temporarily neutralizes anomalous activity and radiation within a radius of about 10 meters from the activation site. To activate, you must activate the device near the anomaly.
A paralyzer pistol developed presumably in the northern part of the exclusion zone.\nAffects humans and mutants, causing a sense of panic in the enemy.

I don't know. They wanted to shut down the radiation on the lower levels to get access to some documents. I don't know the details of it. Look, in the main hall, there's-- there should be an emergency release switch for the front door. This is our chance.

Closed? Holy shit. We were brought up on a standard nighttime alert. A few minutes to pack, then into the chopper. We got here last night. We had a couple of people with us in, you know, orange jumpsuits... they were with the equipment, but they're probably rotting around here somewhere. I don't know what it was. It came out of nowhere. We thought it was one of the surviving scientists, but this thing attacked the lieutenant... chewed off half his face. Damn it, get me out of here!
Alright, alright, you just tell me how. As soon as I walked in here, the door automatically closed. What was your squad's mission and why were they all killed?

Stalker! Ah. Whew. I thought I was gonna stay here forever. Our squad was on a mission here-- all dead. I'm the one who ran away, hid, piled my crates here, fought back for the first...hell how long have I been here...a day or two. Get me the hell out of here, please. I can't do it alone.
Unknown stalker: Damn, that anomaly. Help me get out of here, please.
Unknown stalker: Hey, you're a stalker! By the Tunnel! I'm inside here, please help me!

Messer, you're in the swamp area, aren't you? Got a little errand for you... The scientists at the science camp on Yantar ordered me to get water samples from there. If you're around, do them a favor. There's probably some vials in the complexes, so you can fill them up. Yeah, don't go to Yantar now, there's so much radiation, you'll burn your brains out. Anyway, get some samples, and then when you're near my bunker, drop them off. That's it.
PDA of a stalker of the Black Slime faction. Merchants can offer a good price for it.
PDA of the leader of the Black Slimes. The access code record for the underground complex is access code 4578.
There will be no talking now... Come back in the morning.
Hey, stalker, what do you need?

Stalkers returning from the Zone sell the artifacts they find to an old stalker-trader, he has many connections to the outside world. The customers of artifacts are diverse - scientists, military, representatives of corporations. Customers order Toad to collect certain artifacts, and he in turn gives tasks to stalkers. You can also buy weapons and a variety of equipment from the merchant. Lives in the cellar of an abandoned cabin. He's a bossy fat guy with bulging eyes. Has a very nasty and mean character. Dressed in a tank top and pants, the stump of his left arm is wrapped in black leather. He has difficulty walking because of his broken legs. There are rumors of rookie stalkers that were killed by him, whom he let go on a deliberately deadly mission. But he's the only merchant in the area, you have to go to him. Doesn't put stalkers in anything and is frankly rude to them. Keeps a shotgun on him just in case, mood is as bad as ever.
Alright, head to the bunker site.
An old shabby briefcase with a code lock. Closed. Looks like we can't open it with improvised means. There's something inside.
Hello! We've got a little problem with an expedition that went missing in the Silent Hills. The signal with them was lost in the area around the base. Could you check that place out?
Transmutation requires the artifact Strong Needles and Double Void.
Transmutation requires: artifact Knot and Stinging cotton candy.
The artifact Radioactive Bolt and Rusty Hair are required for transmutation.
Transmutation requires the Toad's Eye artifact and the Transparent Orb.
Transmutation requires: artifact Bagel and Zuda.
I have an artifact transmuter, I'm interested in recipes for it.
Okay, I can sell you the descriptions for the transmutation. The price of the question - 1000 rubles. You'll have the description in your PDA.
Transmutation requires: artifact Weak Gravity and Gravity.
Experimental artifact crossbreeder. The development of scientists from Lake Yantar, allows you to transform anomalous formations in the presence of certain fusion recipes.
A canister of gasoline for refueling cars. The volume is 15 liters.
Scientists hostage: Someone's here! Are we behind us? Hey! Stalker! You're from the Professor?!

Clear Sky Leader's Note: The Zone surged and splashed in all directions, increasing the size of the affected land at breakneck speed, and the cities caught in the waves of the Emission were dying out, while the territory of the Zone kept growing, expanding in all directions. Across the Earth, people look in horror at the blackened sky, and footage from orbit shows a monstrous black blot that is expanding to swallow up the earth. When things quieted down, more than 100 square kilometers became a scary zone. The ground, vegetation, and buildings were covered in black dust. Tons of radioactive dust rose into the air, which was blown by hurricane-force winds over vast areas, contaminating clean bodies of water and fertile land...
Silver pendant. The Elder gave it to me as a reward for my help.

Diary of a legendary stalker nicknamed Strelok. Judging by the appearance of the diary and the entries, the owner of the diary has been keeping it for a very long time. There are records of attempts to break through to the center of the Zone, some diagrams, maps, notes. Footage of a hike to the center of the Zone: Recording #1. So the road is scouted, the plan is made, the supplies are gathered, the barrels are cleaned to a shine. Thanks to the Doctor for helping with medicine and provisions, which we've been short on lately. Hopefully all of this isn't in vain and we find a clue as to what's going on there. It is said that man has it in him that everything that is unknown to him makes him both curious and afraid at the same time. But I feel something else, a third something, like. the call.\nThe main thing is not to forget the main code - 667. That's the most important thing...
A container of medical supplies for the Doctor. Pretty heavy.

This is the Professor from Lake Yantar speaking. In case you haven't heard, the edge of the swamp is under the influence of strong psi radiation. Our workers were doing tests here and what happened to them we do not know. The door of the house where the switch is located is coded as we know, the code is in the possession of another swamp mobile group that left the area due to the Phantasm's psi-influence. Maybe they'll come back and you can find out the code...
Message: Sin Leader: hmm, there he is... You didn't get far. Finish him, stalker. He's already dead!
SOS: Somebody help! I'm in the house, in the swamp...
What do you want?! Get outta here!

Heads of administration of Rostok plant, Nikolaev Oh.D. Order I.I. Zyablikov, an employee of the product delivery department, was transferred from the product delivery department to the research laboratory No.6 due to production needs. Date: 10.02.2005 Signed: Nikolaev Oh.D.
Looks like the plant's human resources department. Or some kind of archive...
Serves as a psychophysical influence, through distracting and overwhelming light and sound effects. Used in hostage rescue and crowd control operations.
A regular set of 5x25mm bolts. Might come in handy in the household.
An anomalous weapon that harnesses the energy of gravitational artifacts. Can be charged with a wide variety of metal junk not exceeding certain dimensions.

Secret To the head of the Psi-Barrier project. Prof. Chubko V.M. From the head of the laboratory K.T.S. Prikhodko P.S. "ZX-16 unit test report on prohibitive modes." The tests were conducted under conditions of forced underestimation by a factor of 2 of the emergency shutdown barrier due to thermal overheating. The ZX-16 unit was activated in its normal psi-field mode, Perimeter Defense. The tests performed showed the appearance of uncontrollable peak-like bursts of psi radiation and induced fields after 5-6 minutes of continuous operation. The strength of the psi-field reached values 50-60 percent higher than the design parameters of the installation. In absolute values, the values are 170-190 psiA. The obtained values are not explained by Kasyanov's theory of induced psi-fields, since the result of psi-field lowering at the moment of transmitter overheating was assumed. Part of the staff believes that the increase in the temperature of the transmitter due to overheating leads to an increase in the parameters of neural activity of the biomass of the pseudo-brain "Ya-1M" and the brain becomes a kind of a repeater of psi radiation, not only a source of psi waves pumping the transmitter. But this claim requires a serious experimental test, for which the team lacks the resources. Others claim that after the experiments they go crazy and don't think much at all. This is indeed a problem - some of the staff will have to be parted with soon. Biomaterials exposed to psi-fields during the experiment unfortunately became unusable due to irreversible changes in the activity of the brain and central nervous system. CT scan and encephalogram data are attached in a separate report. In spite of unexpected and unpredictable results of the experiment on the ZX-16 installation, in general they are very interesting, because they give the right to assert that the use of psi emitter together with pseudo-brain "Ya-1M" can give in the end a more reliable result of the "Psi-barrier" system than similar results of our competitors from the laboratory. 12.12.2007 Prikhodko P.S. P.S. To continue the research we need a new batch of biomaterials, in the amount of: 10 animal specimens and 10 human specimens from 1296- bis. Please also send additional guards, as it is becoming problematic to hold the prisoners after the psi effect. After the last experiment, some of them managed to escape. During the pursuit, the guards managed to eliminate some of them. The rest were driven into a high radiation area and the pursuit was terminated.
To the head of the laboratory Prikhodko P.S. Pavel Stepanovich, in my opinion, after the experiments not only some of the employees, but also you personally are not in order with your head. Fucking experimenter!!! Who gave permission to run the brain-emitter complex under uncalculated conditions!!!? Didn't your grandfather work at Chernobyl Unit 4 in 1986? But if in 86 the staff fell under the impulse of the "Russian Woodpecker" (there is at least some explanation for stupid experiments there), I can find no explanation for your behavior! The manual says in black and white "it is strictly forbidden to increase the psi power above 120 psiA." Did you forget about this? Damn it! As a result, you lost control of the biomaterial and moreover let it escape. Do you realize how hard it is for me to get prisoners for my experiments? Do you realize the danger if ANYONE gets wind of our experiments? I hope you understand. So please, in the future, don't do anything like this without notifying me personally. I understand a young scientist's desire to outrun his competitors, but keep your head up. Speaking of competitors. The lab at their facility yesterday got the psi emitters running steadily with only TWO cooling shutdowns per day. 8-30 to 9-45 in the morning and 20-12 to 21-00 in the evening. Therefore, the comparison with your mode (5 min. work -3 min. rest) is clearly not in favor of the installation of your laboratory. The Psi Barrier should work reliably and without any holes in time. However, I don't want to upset you, I also think that the complex "pseudo-brain - psi emitter" is more progressive, intelligent, and the future is behind it. But. A protective barrier is needed now, so at first it is most likely to use the fully man-made version of your colleagues. Yeah, it works like a sledgehammer - bang and no brains. But, as they say, "without noise and dust", cheap and surly. (just kidding). Please pass on my congratulations to the lab staff on a Happy New Year and Merry Christmas. Prof. Chubko V.M. 20.12.2007 P.S. I will make arrangements for the supply of biomaterials shortly.

Laboratory Order. In connection with the catastrophic processes that began on April 12 of this year in the center of the Exclusion Zone around the Chernobyl NPP, I order: 1. Laboratory staff to copy lab reports and assemble 4 sets of documents. Destroy the original classified documents. 2. Security to dispose of all biomaterials. 3. Perform preservation of the laboratory. 4. Prepare to load the experimental program "Shroud of Darkness" into the pseudo-brain "Ya-1M", as well as the activation of all external tracking sensors. 5. Activate wind turbines and backup power sources. Switch the laboratory to an energy-saving mode. 6. Make your way to the main lab in the Z17-45 area in groups of 3. Each group carries 1 set of documents. One guard is assigned to each group. Everybody wear protective gear. 7. Good luck, everyone. Laboratory Manager Candidate of Technical Sciences Prikhodko P.S.

Posthumous note I, Prikhodko Pavel Stepanovich, head of the laboratory, born in 1976, being in my right mind, voluntarily pass away today April 26, 2008. Now I just want to explain the reasons why. I hope someone finds this note and passes it on to my loved ones and colleagues to whom I remained loyal to the end. Two weeks ago, I signed a mothballing order for our lab. After the events of April 12, the laboratory could no longer operate normally. Communication with the center was lost. Having reproduced the lab results materials I sent four groups of my staff to the main lab. Some of them will make it, I believe. And the invaluable results of our work will not go to waste. And will benefit our GREAT cause. Next. Left alone, I loaded into our brainchild - pseudo-brain "Ya1-M" developed by us program "Shroud of Darkness", which was supposed to make our psi-defense complex ZX-16 to inspire any thinking creature within 200 meters, the absolute invisibility of our laboratory, as well as on a subconscious level to inspire unwillingness of anyone to approach it... Anyway, I'll be brief. I don't know why. But it wasn't the program that worked. When I tried to leave the psi-protected room with the "brain" I received a crushing psi order to defend the facility and kill all uninvited guests. When I woke up, I found myself back in the psi shelter. I don't remember how I got back. Over the past 2 weeks that I've spent in this room - I've asked myself thousands of times, how could a program we just started developing work? The answer scares me. Perhaps the most fantastic hypothesis of my colleagues about the possibility of self-learning in Ya-1M worked. If so, that monster is probably grinning slyly at me right now. I tried to smash his hull, but to no avail. My PM can't do anything about that armored glass. And all the machine guns were taken away by our guards. The only way to shut down the complex now is from the backup control panel. I trapped myself. We ran out of water and provisions a week ago. If I leave the room - the psi radiation will destroy me as a person, and my remaining short days will be spent living the life of plants. I don't want to do that. So I kept the last bullet in my gun. Good luck to all...don't mention it. Paul. April 26, 2008. 13-40
A device that measures anomalous activity. To measure, you must approach the anomalous area, hold the device in your hands, and activate the device.

The GSh-18 is a Russian pistol developed in the late 1990s at the Tula Instrument Design Bureau. It was named after the first letters of the surnames of the designers under whose supervision it was designed (Vasily Gryazev and Arkady Shipunov) and the number "18", meaning the capacity of the magazine.
Ammunition:
basic 9x19mm Parabellum,
enhanced 9x19mm PBP.
Crow carcass. Quite edible, but quite highly radioactive. You can cook it over a campfire.

The files from the abandoned lab. They mention the experiments being conducted in the complex. Particularly over the Burers. There are monthly reports of scientific department work, lists of all researchers, project budgets, and instructions for standard procedures. There is also talk of transferring the results of experiments to another complex. According to the coordinates, it's located somewhere on Yantar.
Digital lighting control. Control codes: 1 - on, 2 - off.
Blocked. You can try to knock it out.

SUPER Series Artifact Detector. This detector is the latest development of local scientists. Thanks to nanotechnology, the sensitivity of the detector has been increased to 1.5 kilometers. The presence of artifacts is indicated by markers on the terrain map. In addition to their locations, the detector recognizes artifact types, making it the best of all the detector series.

PRO Series Artifact Detector. This is an improved version of the INDY artifact detector, having been upgraded by local scientists. Added a terrain map with marker output on its surface. The range has been increased to 70 meters. Due to its reasonable price and improved performance, its use is considered to be the most preferred.

INDY Series Artifact Detector. This is the first artifact detector developed by local artisans. The device is ineffective because its range does not exceed 40 meters, and the presence of an artifact is recognized only by an audible signal. But in its time, more than one and a half thousand artifacts have been found with this device.
Hey, kid! Come here, I have something to do!
Non-working flashlight. I think the batteries are dead.
Disconnect power to the PSI unit.
Power to the PSI unit is turned off.

The data has been corrupted. Last entry: Damn, I think my leg is broken, ah... Apparently it's holed up in the basement, creating a psi blockade... There's no way down! Unless we can get to the psionic control panel and try to lock it down. Shit... The door code is 8620. Good thing the Professor told me, just in case!

The basic data is encrypted, but there is information about the lab. A group of scientists from Lake Yantar moved out to search for equipment. Personal note: as we know the staff left the lab disorganized and chaotic, a lot of very interesting and useful research equipment, ranging from simple dosimeters and dynamometers to experimental weapons and equipment remained there. We'll probably find technical documentation, reports, maybe personal diaries of specialists. All of this should give at least a little insight into what was going on there. Who knows, maybe the information found there will help us bring about another scientific and technological revolution? You should look for documents on the first and second levels of the complex, and equipment in the storage rooms. Note from the Professor: Be extremely vigilant and cautious as test specimens number 1 and 2, as well as the Alpha psionic specimen have disappeared. Maybe they're still in the lab.

A medium-sized scientific artifact container. Designed for hand carrying medium hazard artifacts. Despite the small size, quite provides the necessary protection from the average anomalous and radioactive radiation. It is made of special heavy-duty plastic, coated on top with a layer of the latest metal alloy obtained in a laboratory at Lake Yantar. Highly sought after by professional artifact miners.

A scientific container for artifacts. Designed to carry radioactive artifacts by hand. Despite the small size, quite provides the necessary protection against weak radioactive radiation. It is made of special heavy-duty plastic, coated on top with a layer of the latest metal alloy obtained in a laboratory at Lake Yantar. Highly sought after by professional artifact miners.

A special scientific container for artifacts. Designed for hand carrying particularly dangerous or highly radioactive artifacts. Despite the small size, quite provides the necessary protection against anomalous and radioactive radiation. It is made of special heavy-duty plastic, coated on top with a layer of the latest metal alloy obtained in a laboratory at Lake Yantar. The manufacturing process is kept secret, but it is known that hard radiation of any intensity is almost completely shielded by the walls of the container. Highly sought after by professional artifact miners.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains one artifact.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains two artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains three artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains four artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains five artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains six artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains seven artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains eight artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
Dead rat. Can be consumed. You can cook it over a campfire.
The backpack from the stalker suit. You can make your own stash in a secluded place.

The Kalashnikov 5.45-mm handgun (RPK-74, GRAU Index - 6P18) is a handgun designed to replace the 7.62 mm RPK machine gun in the army as part of the small arms system for the 5.45 mm low-pulse cartridge. Adopted into service in 1974 together with the AK74 assault rifle.

Protecta is a 12-gauge (about 18.5 mm) smoothbore combat shotgun built on a revolver design (formerly known as Striker). It is used in big game hunting. Compact and convenient.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.
Stalker, this is Duty's outpost! If you're going to go to the Bar area, you can go through.

Oh, you stalker! You know, the journalist was kind too, helping me. So about him. One time I was at his place, he told me a story. Anyway, behind the power plant there are some installations that caused that big Emission that hit me back then. And that he's scouting the local neighborhood for documents. Said he wanted to find out what happened in the Zone.
That's it, you don't know anything else?
No, that's all I remember about him... Thank you for your help, I think you'll find what you're looking for...
Hey, stalker, come here! I'm in the house on the hill.
Stalker, you are in the territory of the Duty faction. Don't you dare shoot here!
Messer, I'm up in the hills. Come into my bunker. Toad.

We're thinking of doing a raid on Silent Hills. Those darkies are obviously up to something, so we need to do a little recon. The village to the west of the Hills is suitable for camouflage. The problem is, there's a controller freak in there. It must be destroyed.
We need to pick up Toad's box.

Stalker, it's Toad. I can't believe you're there at the power plant. If you do decide to sneak inside to the Monolith, listen... The entrance to the reactor is behind the plant, on the north side. Double gates. I hope you know what you're doing...

Stalker, it's Toad. I can't believe you're there at the power plant. If you do decide to sneak inside to the Monolith, listen up. The entrance is behind the power plant, on the north side. Double gates. I hope you know what you're doing!
Who the hell is out there?
Quiet, quiet, it's all behind us now...

You mean the scientist from Yantar? Yeah, he lived here. He went missing under unclear circumstances, recently. Our guys wanted to check out the apartment, but the door was jammed. One of our guys tried a few times on the wires from the neighbor's house, but he kept falling off. Doesn't want to anymore... And it looks like the window's boarded up. I think we're gonna have to break the door down. Or blow things up.
Find the entrance to the Lab.
Somewhere in the Generators' territory is the main laboratory. We need to find the entrance to this lab.
Messer! Indications are that you are very close to the installation!
Unknown Stalker: This area is closed to solo stalkers. But if you're here on business, come to our base.
The NTC doesn't have enough money.
Voting is not available on this server.
There are no active votes right now.

A hazmat suit. Weight - 18 kg. Features: protects the body from Blizzard, Stinging Fluff, most anomalousities and mechanical damage. The chest and back are protected by integrated biometallic plates. Equipped with a sealed metal-plastic helmet and two oxygen tanks. Warning: with prolonged use it becomes unusable - damaged and torn.

A hazmat suit. Weight - 8 kg. Features: protects the body from the effects of weak anomalies and mechanical damage. Equipped with an oxygen mask. Warning: with prolonged use it becomes unusable - damaged and torn.

A hazmat suit. Weight - 12 kg. Features: protects the body from Stun, Stinging Fluff, many anomalousities and mechanical damage. Equipped with a pressurized helmet and oxygen tank. Warning: with prolonged use it becomes unusable - damaged and torn.

Orange colored protective spacesuit with a sealed helmet. Weight - 11 kg. Features: protects the body from fire, acids, gases, exposure to a variety of anomalies, Stinging Fluff and mechanical damage. Equipped with two oxygen tanks. Warning: with prolonged use it becomes unusable - damaged and torn.

The device, which detects anomalous fields and disturbances, emits clicks and turns on a red light when a positive reaction occurs.
- does not detect all anomalies
- works unstably, there are failures
- if you have this device, you can scan items in your backpack for radiation.

Anomaly Detector (DA-2).
A device that detects the presence of anomalous fields and disturbances. It beeps when detected. To operate, you must activate by placing the device on your belt.
Number of zones to be defined - 3.
Detection radius 10 m.

Universal anomaly detector (UDA-14a).
A device that detects the presence of anomalous fields and disturbances, as well as centers of radioactive contamination. When detected, it beeps and marks the anomaly on the screen. To operate, you must activate by placing the device on your belt.
The number of zones to be defined is 4.
Detection radius 15 m.
A pocket personal computer is an indispensable device in the Zone.
A flashlight with a fairly powerful bulb. Quite useful in low-light conditions.
A flashlight with a fairly powerful bulb. Thanks to the improved transformer, the battery charging time is reduced.
Medical capsules. A dosage form of medication to treat minor wounds.
A regular soft wheat loaf. Apparently brought into the zone from the Big Land.
Canned meat. Probably from a stalker-run army food depot.
Regular sausage. The composition is unknown, but it seems to be edible.

Vodka. It is good to drink and noticeably reduces the effects of radiation, but should not be abused.
Loss of coordination.
Slightly relieves the effects of radiation sickness.
Quenches thirst

Anti-radiation drugs reduce the effects of radiation on the body.
There are minor side effects with use.
Possible loss of coordination.
A little treatment for radiation sickness.
Dressing material. Helps stop the bleeding.
Universal Medical Kit. Allows you to treat injuries of varying degrees of complexity (wounds, burns, poisoning, etc.).

A specialized medical kit for dealing with physical injuries and bleeding. It includes components to speed up blood clotting, painkillers, antibiotics and immune stimulants - Anti-rad 1pc, Medical Capsule 1pc, Bandage 1pc.

A medical kit designed specifically for working in the Zone. The composition of the kit is selected both to combat wounds and to eliminate radionuclides from the body. Prevents the development of radiation sickness and also reduces the dose of accumulated radiation.
Designed to detect anomalous zones, as well as centers of radioactive contamination.
A regular six-string guitar. Stalkers like to belt out a tune while sitting around a campfire.
A regular harmonica. The simplest musical instrument in the Zone.
Handheld flashlight with increased brightness and illumination range.

A super-precision weapon that the designers in the Zone put together. Artifact energy is used for firing. Despite the enormous power of the shot, the recoil of the Gauss gun is very low. The first version of the Gauss gun in the zone.\nAmmunition - energy containers with ready-to-use killstreaks in the magazine for the gauss-gsg5 rifle.
Energy containers with ready-made killstreaks in the magazine for the gauss-gsg5 rifle.

The OC-12 Tiss is a Russian assault rifle developed by the Tula Central Design Bureau of Sporting and Hunting Weapons (TsKIB SOO) based on the AKS74U. The key difference is the use of special subsonic 9x39mm cartridges (SP-5 and SP-6), which entailed changes in the barrel, blowback device, dimensions of the bolt mirror and magazine. The sight and muzzle brake-compensator have also been modified.

Weapons of unknown origin. Looks like a regular double-barrelled shotgun.
Ammunition:
12x70 shot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.
An experimental weapon of unknown origin.\nCan be loaded with 2-millimeter gauss ammunition.
The VSK-94 (Voyskoy Sniper Complex) is a Russian sniper rifle based on the small-sized 9A-91 assault rifle developed by the Tula Instrument Design Bureau in 1994 for silent and flameless sniper fire.
A 7.62x54 caliber gravipatron, with elements of the artifact gravi.

The PP-19 Bison submachine gun was designed in the early 1990s at the Izhevsk Machine Building Plant to arm the Ministry of Internal Affairs with a modern small-size automatic small arms weapon to replace the AKS-74U.
- 9x18mm, 9x18mm BMP
- effective range 100m
- magazine capacity 64 cartridges

Six-barrel machine gun with electrically driven barrel rotation. As a hand weapon, it can only be used with a hydraulic exoskeleton. Inside the Zone, it is extremely rare due to the inconvenience of using it in the field. The army uses to defend the perimeter against swarms of mutants.

The complex consists of a 9x39mm assault rifle and a 40mm underbarrel grenade launcher. The automatic system operates by expulsion of powder gases from the barrel channel, locking the barrel by turning the bolt. The rifle is based on bullpup layout, and one of the most significant disadvantages of this layout has been solved - displacement of the center of mass of the weapon and location of the extractor close to Strelok's face, which leads to the fact that the weapon intended for use by right-handed shooters cannot be used by left-handed shooters, because hot fired cartridges fly into their faces. The first drawback was eliminated by the underbarrel grenade launcher, and a special channel was made for the shell casings, through which the casings were carried forward and discharged outside on the right side near the pistol grip. Later, a similar cartridge case pattern was used in the Belgian FN F2000 rifle. The closed receiver also protects the receiver from dirt, which has a positive effect on reliability.

The AG-40 is a grenade launcher used by the PA md. 86. Originally firing a proprietary 40mm round, all AG-40's in the Zone have been rechambered to accept the 40mm VOG-25 round by either Zone gunsmiths or contract gunsmiths working for the Ukrainian military; all of them are converted for the sake of simplifying logistics.

The PA md. 86 is the current service rifle of the Romanian Army. Large amounts of them have made their way into Zone, circulated by arms dealers buying them in bulk and selling them to the Ukrainian Army or independent stalkers. Some prefer the PA md. 86 over the AK-74 due to its improved ergonomics.

Kalashnikov assault rifle of 5.45 mm caliber, developed in 1970 by designer M.T. Kalashnikov and adopted by the USSR Armed Forces in 1974. It is a further development of the AKM. The development of the AK-74 is related to the transition to the new low-pulse 5.45 mm cartridge.

The third-generation MANPADS Igla successfully operates in conditions of natural (background) and artificial interference (false thermal targets), to this day remaining one of the best complexes in its class.

Usage:
Turn on the power supply.
Within 5 seconds, the missile is placed on alert - the homing head cools to operating temperature and the target tracking coordinator gyroscope unwinds.
Aim the launcher at the target. When a target appears in the field of view of the GSN, the thermal radiation flux hits the coordinator. If the flow rate is greater than the coordinator's minimum sensitivity, an audible alarm sounds. The target is captured and the launch lock is released.
When a beep is heard, the missile is launched. The power supply remains operational for about 40 seconds after being turned on. If no launch has been made within this time, the missile is unsuitable for further use. Target acquisition is impossible when the angle between the target and the Sun is less than 20 degrees.

Ammunition:
Guided Missile Needle.
UR Needle in the launch tube

Guided missile Igla in the launch tube. The missile is equipped with a dual-channel infra-red sounder, which provides high noise immunity of the missile against natural and artificial thermal interference. The fuze ensures detonation of the warhead both on direct hit and when flying in close proximity to the target. To increase effectiveness, the residual propellant of the missile is detonated along with the warhead.

Rumor has it this barrel was found in a pile of rust in the Garbage. The same place where the gravity anomaly was for three months. I'm surprised the barrel itself isn't rusted through. On the contrary - how many shots have been fired out of it already, and the wear is still not noticeable.\nFeatures: Strongly inferior to the regular Kalashnikov in accuracy and damage, but lighter and more agile.\nThe AKS-74U is similar in size and weight to submachine guns, but due to the cartridge and mechanisms used, it is still considered to be a shortened assault rifle. The advantages of the AKS-74U include high mobility in cramped conditions, the possibility of concealed carry, and a fairly high penetration capacity of the cartridge. Disadvantages - short sighting range, low stopping power of the bullet, tendency to overheat during firing. The magazine capacity is 30 rounds. The base ammunition is 5.45x39 FMJ, 5.45x39 AP armor-piercing round.
A sample Gauss rifle with an enlarged magazine.
The personal knife of a stalker nicknamed Crowbar. The handle is rubbed, however the knife fits perfectly in the hand.
Halogen flashlight. Experimental sample, malfunctions may occur.

Features: by modifying the bolt it was possible to increase the speed of the IED, unfortunately the accuracy suffered.\nThe Dragunov rifle is a more modern version of the Dragunov bullpup rifle, which is very convenient for traveling in the Zone, and is a compact version of the powerful automatic sniper rifle. It's hard to get. Unless you take it from a military stalker in combat. The magazine capacity is 10 rounds. The basic ammunition is 7.62X54 7h1 , the armor-piercing ammunition is 7.62X54 ar, the sniper ammunition with improved characteristics is 7.62X54 7h14.

Features: The barrel is sprayed with powder derived from a graviartefact.\nThe G36 assault rifle is a first-class example of modern German weaponry - it is lightweight, reliable and easy to handle. The magazine capacity is 30 rounds. The base ammunition is 5.56X45 SS109 , 5.56X45 AR armor-piercing round. The ammunition for the underbarrel is M209 grenades. A veteran's or master's weapon.

A unique piece with improved optics.\nFeatures: Gift inscribed screwcutter. In addition to the lettering, adjustments have been made to improve the accuracy of the gun.\nSniper-Specialty Rifle. Designed for silent and flameless sniper shooting. The rifle has an integrated silencer. A very "respected" gun in the Zone. From 400 meters, it pierces any body armor that a real person can wear without assistance. At the same time, it can be done almost silently. The weapon of the seasoned stalker and veteran. The magazine capacity is 20 rounds. The base ammunition is 9x39 PAB-9, 9x39 AP armor-piercing round, and 9x39 SP5 sniper round.

Good reliability.\nFeatures: a modified version of the popular pistol. Created in the scientists' bunker specifically for expedition self-defense.\nThe Beretta is in service with the U.S. Armed Forces, many other paramilitary and law enforcement organizations, and police forces, both in the U.S. and in other countries. 9mm caliber. The magazine capacity is 15 rounds. Base ammunition is 9x19 FMJ, performance-enhanced ammunition is 9x19 PBP.
The base cartridge for Colt M1911, Sig-Sauer P220, USP Compact, and Desert Eagle pistols. Simple core, jacketed bullet.
It's called HydroShock. An enhanced performance cartridge for the Colt M1911, Sig-Sauer P220, USP Compact, and Desert Eagle pistols. An expansive bullet with good stopping power.

A regular 12-gauge cartridge loaded with 6mm shot. At close ranges, it has tremendous killing power. Designed for shotguns TOZ-34, BM-16, Mossberg 88, SPAS-12, Protecta, Striker. Most effective at ranges up to 30 meters.

Pointed bullet that stabilizes in flight, which has a positive effect on accuracy. For shotguns TOZ-34, BM-16, Mossberg 88, SPAS-12, Protecta, Striker. Increased range and armor-piercing power - effective at ranges up to 150 meters.

A cartridge with a heavy breech-loading bullet. Usually used for hunting large animals, but suitable for other purposes as well. Its heavy bullet does not pierce, but actually pierces through body armor. Designed for shotguns TOZ-34, BM-16, Mossberg 88, SPAS-12, Protecta, Striker. Effective at ranges up to 100 meters.
Armor-piercing cartridge for AKS-74, AKS-74U assault rifles. Improved armor-piercing ability of the bullet.
Standard cartridge for AKS-74, AKS-74U assault rifles. Simple core, jacketed bullet.
Armor-piercing bullet cartridge for L85, LR-300, Sig-550, G36, FN-2000 assault rifles.
Standard NATO cartridge, commonly known by the Belgian SS109 index. Used in L85, LR-300, Sig-550, G36, FN-2000 assault rifles.
A low-cost modification of the sniper cartridge for SVD, SVU-AS and PKM sniper rifles.
Sniper cartridge for SVD, SVU-AS sniper rifles and PKM machine gun. It has improved accuracy and range characteristics.
Armor-piercing bullet. For SVD, SVU-AS sniper rifles and PKM machine gun.
Basic cartridge for PM, PB, Fort-12, APS pistols. Simple core, jacketed bullet. Weak armor-piercing effect.

Cartridge with improved ballistic characteristics for PM, PB, Fort-12, APS pistols. Due to the higher muzzle velocity of the bullet, it is much more effective than a conventional cartridge. More pronounced armor-piercing effect.
A cartridge with improved characteristics for PM, PB, Fort-12, APS pistols. Powerful cartridge with expansive bullet and armor-piercing core.
Basic cartridge for HPSA, Walther P-99, Beretta92FS, GSh-18 pistols. A jacketed bullet. Weak armor-piercing effect.
Improved performance cartridge for HPSA, Walther P-99, Beretta92FS, GSh-18 pistols. Powerful cartridge with expansive bullet and armor-piercing core.
Armor-piercing cartridge for Groza, Val and special Vintorez sniper rifle. It has subsonic flight speed, but due to the special bullet design it penetrates most body armor at ranges up to 400 meters.

Cartridge for Groza, Val and special Vintorez sniper rifle. A later and cheaper to manufacture modification of the armor-piercing cartridge. It has subsonic flight speed, but due to the special bullet design it penetrates most body armor at ranges up to 300 meters.

Sniper cartridge for Groza, Val and special Vintorez sniper rifles. It has subsonic flight speed, but due to the heavy bullet of special design it penetrates most body armor at ranges up to 400 meters.
Energy receptacles with ready-made killstreaks in the magazine for the Gauss rifle.
Grenade for M203 underbarrel grenade launcher. Used in LR-300, G36, Sig-550, L85 assault rifles and for integrated grenade launcher in FN-2000.
Fuzed fragmentation grenade for RPG-7B. Equally effective against both manpower and lightly armored vehicles.
Standard grenade for GP-25 Kostyor underbarrel grenade launcher, Groza integrated underbarrel grenade launcher and RG-6 revolver grenade launcher.

Grenade for GP-25 Kostyor underbarrel grenade launcher, Groza integrated underbarrel grenade launcher and RG-6 revolver grenade launcher. Before detonation, the grenade jumps up to a height of about a meter, which increases its impact effect.
A hand-held defensive grenade with a large fragmentation radius. Throwing is recommended only from shelter.
Hand-held smoke grenade. Designed for the installation of a smoke cover. Time of action is 10 seconds.
Offensive hand grenade. The fragmentation damage radius is small.

AKM variant with metal buttstock folding down under the forend. The stock mounting system has been changed compared to the AKS. The buttstock is raised to bring the point of rest closer to the firing line. The modification is designed specifically for paratroopers.
An assault rifle equipped with a modified telescopic sight for sniper fire. The body-mounted optics have a higher magnification than standard sights.
This assault rifle is equipped with an integrated underbarrel grenade launcher, making this model an even more versatile weapon.
Under-barrel grenade launcher for assault rifles used in Warsaw Pact countries.\nAmmunition - VOG-25\ngrenade and VOG-25P grenade.
Underbarrel grenade launcher for NATO rifles.\nAmmunition - M203 grenades.
Widely used Soviet-made telescopic sight. The standard dovetail mount of the Warsaw Pact countries is used for mounting on the weapon.
Optical 4x scope manufactured in NATO countries. Mounted on a standard NATO mount - the so-called Picatinny bar.
An effective silencer, assembled in the Zone by some skilled craftsmen. It comes with a set of adapters for any caliber weapon.

A 1974 model folding assault rifle chambered for 5.45x39mm cartridge. It is a simple and reliable weapon, although the cheapness of production has somewhat affected the usability and accuracy of combat. In the Zone, it is the primary weapon of military stalkers and many loners.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.45x39mm,
armor-piercing 5.45x39mm BP.
Modified bolt mechanism increases the rate of fire.

By its dimensions and weight the AKS-74U is close to submachine guns, but the principle of operation of the mechanism of this weapon and the cartridge used in it make it a representative of the submachine gun class. Advantages include small size, which is extremely useful in urban combat, and a fairly high penetrating power of the cartridge. The main disadvantages are short sighting range and tendency to overheat quickly when firing in bursts.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.45x39mm,
armor-piercing 5.45x39mm BP.

It is in service with the U.S. military and police forces, as well as many paramilitary and law enforcement units around the world. Equally popular with the criminal world due to its powerful cartridge and large magazine capacity.
Ammunition:
basic 9x19mm Parabellum,
enhanced 9x19mm PBP.

This shotgun is one of the most common weapons for beginners.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.

Classic automatic Colt, which has passed with honor all the armed conflicts of the XX century and confidently entered the new century. The low magazine capacity is compensated to a certain extent by the use of a powerful cartridge.
Ammunition:
regular 11.43x23 FMJ,
enhanced 11.43x23 "HydroShock".

A real gun for real heroes. Big, heavy, and extremely killable. Because of the price and size is not particularly popular in the Zone, after all, not every day you hunt an elephant.
Ammunition:
regular .45 ACP,
enhanced .45 ACP HydroShock.

FN2000 with computerized fire control module sight and 40mm grenade launcher.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

The Fort 12 pistol is a police pistol to replace the morally and physically obsolete PM (Makarov) pistols of the Soviet era. It has better accuracy than the PM, larger magazine capacity and more comfortable grip.
Ammunition:
basic 9x18mm,
enhanced 9x18mm PMM.

German-made assault rifle, which is a first-class example of a modern weapon - lightweight, reliable and ergonomic.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

A super-precision weapon that the designers in the Zone put together. Operates almost silently, as it uses artifact energy rather than gunpowder gases to fire. Despite the enormous power of the shot, the recoil of the Gauss gun is very low. It is superior to any classic small arms weapon in accuracy and killing power.\nAmmunition is 2-millimeter gauss ammunition.

Automatic grenade launcher is a very successful variant of the assault rifle in the Zone conditions: compact, reliable, and at the same time versatile and powerful. Thunderstorm is much favored by military stalkers.
Ammunition:
regular 9x39mm PAB-9,
armor-piercing 9x39mm SP-6,
sniper 9x39mm SP-5,
for underbarrel grenades VOG-25 and VOG-25P.

Produced by the Belgian company FN Erstal. The Browning HP (High Power) family of pistols is designed for police and military use. They are in service in more than 100 countries around the world. The Browning High Power is deservedly considered one of the finest pistols of the twentieth century.
Ammunition:
basic 9x19mm Parabellum,
enhanced 9x19mm PBP.
A hunting knife. An indispensable weapon if you need to take someone out quietly.

After this rifle was replaced by the British Army with the German G36, it surfaced in large numbers on the black market and then in the Zone. The main advantages of the L85 are the standard 4x scope and the high accuracy of the first shot. When firing in bursts, the accuracy of the rifle drops drastically, and the reliability of the main mechanisms of the rifle is not high enough.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

The latest development of the American company Z-M Weapons, whose owner Allan Zitta is well known in gun circles for his many years of experience in technical development of .Colt-based combat and sporting pistols. 1911. The LR-300 is nothing short of a new stage in the development of the AR-15. LR-300 stands for Lightweight Rifle Effective Fire Rifle up to 300 meters. Compared to the AR-15, the AR-15 utilizes a shorter gas system, significantly modified gas exhaust system and completely reconstructed upper part of the bolt carrier.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

One of the best in the submachine gun class of weapons. During the last decades of the XX century, it was adopted by special units of the army and police in many countries of the world. With the beginning of its gradual replacement by more modern models began to appear often on the black market, from where it massively got into the Zone.
Ammunition:
basic 9x19mm Parabellum,
enhanced 9x19mm PBP.

HK 53 - HK33KA3 variant with shortened barrel to 211mm, extended four-slot flame arrester and forend similar to HK MP5. It is not possible to install underbarrel grenade launcher and bayonet knife. Produced since 1975 and used by special forces.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

A pistol with an integrated silencer, once used by the Soviet Special Forces. Morally obsolete, but in capable hands still quite effective.
Ammunition:
basic 9x18mm,
enhanced 9x18mm PMM.

Designed and manufactured by Izhevsk Machine Engineering Plant in Russia for police and military armament since 1951, this Soviet legacy is the most common pistol in the Zone and is one of the best compact self-defense handguns available. It is small, highly reliable, easy to use and maintain in working order. It also suffers from several drawbacks, including its short range, low firing accuracy and poor stopping power, while also losing out to modern pistols in its class in terms of weight and magazine size.
Ammunition:
basic 9x18mm,
enhanced 9x18mm PMM.

Revolver-type grenade launcher. Sometimes just indispensable, in particular when clearing large areas of mutants, attacking guarded stationary objects, in combat with particularly tenacious creatures.\nAmmunition - VOG-25 grenade,\nand VOG-25P grenade.

A grenade launcher from the 1960s, left in huge quantities in army warehouses, from where it got into the Zone. A rare weapon for stalkers: its impressive size and heavy weight make it not too popular, although for some tasks it is indispensable.\nAmmunition - OG-7B.

A model developed back in 1975, but still popular all over the world. The magazine is not big enough, but the mechanism is as reliable as a Swiss watch; the second advantage is the use of a powerful Colt cartridge.
Ammunition:
regular 11.43x23 FMJ,
enhanced 11.43x23 HydroShock.

One of the relatively new Swiss assault rifles chambered for the 5.56x45mm SS109 cartridge. The accuracy, soft recoil and high reliability of this weapon quickly gained it the widest popularity.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

The SPAS-12 shotgun was developed in the late 1970s as a versatile combat weapon for police and Army assault units. These weapons are characterized by high reliability and flexibility of use; on the other hand, they are rather massive, complicated and expensive. Perhaps, there is no better gun for close combat in the Zone.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.

Sniper rifle. It has been widely used in all combat operations conducted by the Soviet and Russian armies since the 1960s. Has proven to be an extremely reliable and easy to handle weapon. In the Zone, it is especially favored by experienced stalkers of the "Duty" faction.
Ammunition:
conventional 7.62x54 mm 7H1,
armor-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP,
sniper 7.62x54 mm 7H14.

A more modern version of the rifle, designed in a compact bullpup pattern. Very good for long distance travel in the Zone.
Ammunition:
conventional 7.62x54 mm 7H1,
armor-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP,
sniper 7.62x54 mm 7H14.

TOZ-34 is a two-barrel light-type hunting rifle with low barrels designed for commercial and recreational hunting. Produced piece by piece since 1964 at the Tula Arms Factory.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.

Solid trunk. German quality and reliability. A compact melee weapon. Particularly popular with veterans of the Zone. A variant for the 0.45ACP caliber. The magazine capacity is 8 rounds.
Ammunition:
regular 11.43x23 FMJ,
enhanced 11.43x23 HydroShock.

It is based on the Vintorez silenced sniper rifle, from which it differs by its folding buttstock, the ability to fire in bursts, and a larger magazine. Originally intended for use by special forces in attack situations requiring silent and flameless firing.
Ammunition:
conventional 9x39mm PAB-9,
armor-piercing 9x39mm SP-6,
sniper 9x39mm SP-5.

The VSS Vintorez (Special Vintorez Sniper Rifle) was developed on the basis of the AS Val by designers P. Serdyukov and V. Krasnikov at the Central Research Institute of Precision Machine Building and adopted for service in 1987. The Vintorez is designed for silent and flameless sniper shooting.
Ammunition:
conventional 9x39mm PAB-9,
armor-piercing 9x39mm SP-6,
sniper 9x39mm SP-5.

Excellent German-made pistol with high reliability, large magazine capacity and good accuracy, especially in this version - for 9mm Parabellum cartridge.
Ammunition:
basic 9x19mm Parabellum,
enhanced 9x19mm PBP.

American-made pump action shotgun, designed for use in the most adverse conditions and characterized by high reliability. All parts are provided with an anti-corrosion coating.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.
A stalker nicknamed Crowbar used to work as a mechanic in a locksmith factory. He made small changes in the design of his AK-74M, which increased the weapon's rate of fire.

Sniper rifle, special, modernized. Designed for silent and flameless sniper shooting and features an integrated silencer. The firing mechanism was modified to reduce wear and tear during firing. The magazine was also enlarged to 20 rounds.

Unshortened version of the BM-16 shotgun. It is distinguished from the Obrez by its greater nastiness and accuracy. Suitable for hunting boars and larger animals. Often seen in rookies and on sale at merchants.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 javelin,
12x76 dart.

Belgian submachine gun developed in the 1980s by FN Herstal. Despite its unusual appearance, it is quite effective. In the Zone, the FN P90 was fairly quickly redesigned for a special 5.56x45mm cartridge with more penetrating power than other pistol cartridges. The gun is easy to use and has extremely low recoil.
Ammunition:
conventional 5.56x45mm SS109,
armor-piercing 5.56x45mm AR.

Such weapons are usually equipped with heavily armed squads of military stalkers. It is extremely rare in the Zone, due to its large size and weight, which sometimes requires wearing an exoskeleton to shoot from hand.\nAmmunition:\narmor-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP.

APS is an automatic pistol developed in the late 1940s and early 1950s and adopted by the Soviet Armed Forces in 1951, at the same time as the Makarov pistol. APS is intended for arming officers taking direct part in combat operations, as well as for soldiers and sergeants of some special units.
- 9x18mm, 9x18mm BMP
- effective range 100m
- magazine capacity 20 rounds\
Description: A super-powered psi wave emitter of unknown type. It looks like an ordinary lamp.

Description: Has interesting and unpredictable properties. For example, it increases resistance to breakouts. Rumor has it that if you fall asleep with this artifact being zombified, the disease can recede and the artifact itself will disappear...
